She currently has some laying hens that she relies on to produce the eggs that she sells, but she'd like to increase production as her product is in high demand. She relies on established poultry dealers and her clientele, which is what's important.

She hopes to receive the help and that way be able to buy the hens to generate more production and income for her well-being and that of her husband, who isn't able to work.

This is her second loan from FUDECOSUR. She's never had a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with more facility and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: buy chickens and laying hens.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is from Kalasan, Pagadian City. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for them. He is earning a living through his coconut farm.

To generate more income, Gerardo decided to expand his farm after he learned that he can get financial assistance from PMPC. As Gerardo has saved money from his business, he has thought of farming activities to earn additional income. Consequently, he requested a loan to pay for a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start his farming project.

Gerardo smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family and even his grandchildren a better life.

loans.use: to pay for a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start his farming project.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Retailing helped Lucila survive for the family. She retails rice and charcoal. It brings a meager income of PHP 4,000 per month in addition to her husband's income to provide for their needs. She found the business of buying and selling of rice and charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers as well as the rice for retail.

Lucila plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase more inventory of charcoal and four bags of rice for retail.

Lucila smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies and live comfortably with them.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of charcoal and four bags of rice for retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Herminia has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Herminia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Herminia hopes to purchase another plot of rice land to cultivate; that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Celsa Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Celsa, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de  un año y medio de edad. Su esposo es electricista y comerciante.
Doña Celsa realiza el crédito para que su marido el cual se dedica a varias actividades para solventar los gastos del hogar, el realiza trabajos de electricidad por contratos con particulares, pero también él se dedica con su esposa a la cría de chanchos con lo cual pueden ganar lo suficiente para salir adelante, el  compra los chanchos pequeños para  luego alimentarlos  por espacio de 4 a 5 meses y luego cuando están grandes los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar chanchos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la ayuda de los créditos  por lo cual esta agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que hacen posible estos créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Las Decididas (The Decided Ones) meet, every 15 days, in the city of Portoviejo. This is a group of people who dedicate themselves to diverse activities to improve their quality of life; they work in commerce and food sales, among other activities.

Celsa lives in this place. She's 21 years old, married and has a one-and-a-half-year-old daughter. He husband is an electrician and businessman.

Celsa is requesting this loan to help her husband, who works in various activities, pay the household expenses. He does electrical work on contracts with particulars, but he also works with his wife in the breeding of pigs, so they can make enough to get ahead. He buys piglets and feeds them for a duration of 4 to 5 months and when they're big, he gives them to dealers who come to their house.

She will use this loan to buy pigs, food and medicine so the pigs will be raised well. She has had three cycles with this communal bank and she's happy for the help the loans give her and she's grateful to the foundation and those who make the loans possible. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: buy pigs, and food and medicine for pigs.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: After learning about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and hearing about all the the benefits and financial services, Rosela didn't hesitate to become a member. She has tried her luck by operating a business focused on farming activities. Rosela feels she owes her luck to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She is now borrowing another loan to pay for labour to plow her squash area. This will give her farming income a big boost. Rosela is seeking better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labour plowing squash area

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Retailing helped Nerissa provide for the family. She has a store that sells various food commodities and grocery items. Nerissa also engages in tuba (coconut wine) vending for additional earnings. She found the retailing business easy and simple because all she needed to do is to display and tend her store for her buyers.

Nerissa plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the required capital. She wants to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional containers of tuba for retail.

Nerissa smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional containers of tuba (coconut wine) for retail.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 58 years old and lives in Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. He is a widower.

Gregorio runs a furniture shop, making and selling various furniture items. It also offers services like wood carving and molding. He has had this business for years. Gregorio requested a loan to purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture to meet his increasing orders. Gregorio has been a member of PMPC for 4 years now.

In the future, Gregorio hopes to own a furniture showroom to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture to meet his increasing orders

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.en:
Her name is Eriberta, 53, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a farmer, and has three children. She manages their household while operating the business to augment their income to meet their everyday expenses.

Eroberta has an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, bromeliads, also a variety of hanging plants and others alike. Her regular customers are locals, tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her expand her farm, Eriberta is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizers, pots, nets, screen and plastics for a productive ornamental plant business. She has been in this business for ten years and her customers have increased over the years. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her for it will surely help in their daily needs and for the schooling of her children.

Eriberta dreams for her ornamental plant business to continue to flourish. She hopes to save money for their old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, pots, nets, screen and plastics for her ornamental plants business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for and harvesting, and is earning income, as well.

Teofila has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Teofila has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and bags of chicken manure. Someday, Teofila hopes to purchase a parcel of agricultural land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and bags of chicken manure

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has started her small business and become a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls over her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she is happy tending her store and makes good sales.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to provide a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Adrina

texts.en: Adrina makes good earning from her farm in Sindangan. This is the primary means of her family's income, supporting their needs. She wants to increase her farm yield. Adrina approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase herbicides and compost for the fruit-bearing trees on her farm. She has high hopes that she will have a good yield next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and compost for fruit-bearing trees on her farm

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is a 45-years-old married woman, residing at Sapang Dalaga, in the Philippines. To make a living, she buys and sells assorted products. She joined PMPC on April 10, 2014 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. Recently, she is accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her existing business, to buy assorted products to resell in her local community. She is focusing on selling fertilizers and vegetables for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy assorted products to sell

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en: Retailing has helped Anelia survive for her family. She retails grocery goods and various consumable items. It brings in a meager income of Php 6,000 per month. Anelia has found the retailing business easy and simple because all she needs to do is to patiently tend her store. Anelia plans to expand her retailing business. She has applied for a loan to PMPC for her needed capital. She wants to purchase more inventory for retail. Anelia smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for retail

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita has learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives for business start-ups. Lolita tried her luck in doing a business focusing on farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as initial capital. Lolita has loaned another amount to pay for seedlings, compost and fertilizer. This will give her farming income a big boost. Lolita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, compost and fertilizer.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is grateful that she was granted a 28,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy undergarments, shampoo, cologne, soap, perfume, food containers etc needed in her business. Her income from selling as a dealer helps cover her family’s daily needs. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. She hopes for a good return on her investment for it will sure fund their everyday needs and provide for her children's education as well.

Tomasa dreams to have a store of her own to display her products and attract more customers. She aims to send all her children to College to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, 48 years old, lives in Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari store.

It began with selling a small inventory of canned goods, noodles and oil to her neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2013 and has received loans several times now. Recently, she applies for 10,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception makes good earning with her farming activities in Pagadian. This is how she supports her husband in providing for their family and how she was able to send her children to school.

Conception wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. Conception approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to pay for fertilizer and compost. She has high hopes that she will have good and higher produce yields this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos 22, 20, 16, 15 y 13 años  de edad, todos aun viven con ella y 2 estudian en universidad y los tres menores en colegio. Su esposo es cerrajero.
Doña Rosa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de  catalogo de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual tiene un taller de cerrajería en el cual fabrica una gran variedad de productos hechos con hierro. Ella lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y su esposo mucho mas, así ellos logran darles a sus hijos una gran educación que para ella es lo mas importante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, bisuterías y hierro para el taller de su marido. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the members of the "Las Decididas" communal bank meet every fortnight This is a group of people with a variety of businesses to improve their quality of living. They work in commerce, selling food and amongst other activities.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 42 years old. married and from this relationship has five children aged 22, 20, 16, 15 and 13 years old. All of them still live with her, two study in university and the younger ones in secondary school. Her husband is a metal worker.

Rosa is a housewife who in order to obtain her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses works selling Avon and Yanbal products from catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She sells from door to door. She will also give part of the loan to her husband who has a shop where he makes a great variety of products made from steel. She has 7 years working in this business and her husband has many more and this is how they manage to give their children a good education which is very important to her.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, jewellery and steel for her husband's workshop. She has been in the communal bank for more than 3 years and she likes it as the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream. cosmetics, jewellery and iron.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011. She appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

Leonila has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs.

Leonila dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Her name is Margie, 35, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to a policeman and has two children. One of her children is in High School and the other one is still at Elemenary Level. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Margie has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of the popular direct selling brands. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. Aside from personal products she also sells delicacies and candies. She earns a minimum of PHP 2500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to purchase clothes, watches, cosmetics, skin and beauty products and cleaning agents to meet the advanced orders of her growing clients. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Margie aims to grow her business so she could send her children to the best school possible. She dreams to see both her children become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products like clothes, watches, cosmetics, skin and beauty products and cleaning agents to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has solidified her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs.

teodora is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 45,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Teodora also operates a house for rent for additional profit and she wants to expand soon. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gervacio, a mechanic/welder and has two children who are High School students. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. She and her husband work hard to be able provide for their family's needs.

Alma operates a welding/repair repair shop. They offer repairs, check-ups, beautification, welding and tinting of all types of cars, jeepneys and any type of vehicle that is referred to them.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan to buy supplies like car interior and upholstery supplies, putty, paint, tints and other equipment needed in her repair shop.

Alma hopes to improve her service and attract more clients. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her equipment, and but items such as upholstery, paint and tint for her repair/welding shop service.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en:
Sokna is aged 31 years old and married. She lives with her family with three dependent children in a rural area located in Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham Province. Cassava and rubber planting have been the main sources of her family income for almost 10 years.

Her group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have a better standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund.

As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for growing cassava. With this loan, she hopes to buy more plots of farmland in order to extend her farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Burma

texts.ru: Бурма, 54 года, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 15 лет назад стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Бурма достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бурмы имеется лошадь, 5 овец. На собственном участке мерою 7,0 Га она выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. Бурма обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Бурма планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Burma is 54 years old, married and has grown and independent children. In search of an income source for her family, she got involved in farming and animal husbandry 15 years ago. Thanks to her backbreaking labor and substantial work, Burma has achieved good results in work and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Today, Burma's farm contains a horse and 5 sheep. She also grows potatoes and beans for sale on 7.0 hectares of land. Burma requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 calves and 20 sheep. Burma plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves and 20 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn has always dreamed of owning and managing her own retailing business to support her husband in raising their family, most especially with the education of her three children. She used her loan to buy a variety of food commodities for retailing. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food commodities for retailing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 59 years old. She is married and has 11 children. She lives in Pagadian. Patricia and her husband earn a living through farming. They mastered this type of activity when they got married. They have been able to support her children's education and their family needs.

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in February of 2011. She is a hardworking mother who has a strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. Patricia requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have a good, high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm. This will give her farming income a big boost.

Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and engage in agricultural business ventures to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a good, high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel has always the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their land, planting corn, vegetables and watermelon in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. It has yielded good earnings for doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the land is ready for planting. Ritchel knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. Ritchel smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 41 years old and married. She is blessed with one child.

Sally has always dreamed of managing her own business to support her needs. She is now engaged in running a quarrying business, buying and selling sand and gravel, and making hollow-blocks. She used her loan as working capital to pay for more loads of sand and gravel and pay for bags of cement for making hollow-blocks to meet the demands of her customers.

Sally is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to pay for more loads of sand and gravel and bags of cement for making hollow-blocks to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old and lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran. He is married with two school-age kids. Daniel has owned a shop that offers electronics repair and other services for three years already. He earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. 

Daniel has requested a loan to be used in purchasing new equipment, materials and other accessories for his electronics repair shop business. Daniel has been a member of PMPC for almost three years now. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his electronics repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment, materials and other accessories for his electronics repair shop business

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group, Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business.

Arlyn has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs.

Arlyn wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family with a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 58 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children now adults in age.

Elma has been engaged in the hog fattening and hog raising business for 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 additional head of gilts (young female pigs) for her hog raising business.

Elma has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Elma hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 additional head of gilts (young female pigs).

loans.name: Mary Bebelu

texts.es:
Mary Berbelu tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en la zona rural de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yucas, maíz a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y pavos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad desde que se caso para apoyar con los gastos de la familia, su esposo brinda servicios de albañilería. Ha solicitado un préstamo para terminar los acabados de su cocina, reposteros, ventanas y una puerta y de esta manera tener un lugar limpio y seguro para preparar los alimentos a su familia, con esto ella espera vivir más cómodamente y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mary Berbelu is 31 years old. she lives with her children in a rural part of the district of Oyotún. It's inhabitants work growing rice, yucca and corn two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the North Coast of Peru.

Mary works raising and selling pigs and turkeys behind her house. She has worked in this business since she got married in order to support the household expenses. Her husband provides bricklayer services. . She is requesting a loan to do the finishing work on her kitchen, shelves, windows and a door and in this way have a clean and safe place to prepare food for her family. By doing this she hopes to live more comfortably and in this way improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to do the finishing work on her kitchen, shelves, windows and a door.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase the additional grocery products she needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more with this loan amount of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This new loan will go towards additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Marilyn dreams of developing her small store into a big store. She hopes to give the best education for her children through all her hard work in her business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to pay for new dogs, dog food, shampoo, and other supplies for dogs which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business with this loan amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This new loan will go to additional dogs and supplies for dogs, which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Rona wants to have a bigger space for her pet shop and she also plans to buy different types of animals. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for dogs, dog food, and shampoo for the dogs.

loans.name: Batyina

texts.ru: Батыйна, 37 лет, замужем, есть 3 дочери. У Батыйны высшее образование. Она жизнерадостная и экономная. Около 15 лет назад начала заниматься животноводческой и полеводческой деятельностью, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), Батыйна сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме до 26,500 сом (KGS). В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются: 3 коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади. На 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень. В целях расширения своего хозяйства Батыйна обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на полученные денежные средства она намерена купить овец для увеличения поголовья. Батыйна планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, хочет отремонтировать сарай.
texts.en: Batyina is 37 years old, married and has 3 daughters. Batyina has a college education. She is happy and economic. She got involved in animal husbandry and farming about 15 years ago, starting this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Batyina was able to grow her business to yield a monthly income of up to 26,500 som (KGS). Today her farm contains 3 cows, 10 sheep and 2 horses. She grows barley on 1.0 hectare of leased land. In order to expand her business, Batyina requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank and intends to buy sheep to increase her livestock headcount. Batyina plans to invest the earnings from the business into further growing it and wants to repair a barn.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Phana's Group

texts.en:
Phana is aged 24 years old and married. She lives with her family with three dependent children in a rural area located in Kompong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer and sometimes she works as a paid worker to earn additional income for her family. She has been engaged in this business for six years.

Her group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is a new client who just accessed a loan with VisionFund for the first cycle. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

With this loan, she hopes to earn more income and be able to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 24 года, замужем, есть дочь 2014 года рождения. Образование у Айнагул среднее. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Айнагул имеет 4 коровы. Также на 0,74 ГА собственной земли она выращивает пшеницу. Ее квартальный совокупный доход составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Айнагул намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainagul is 24 years old, married and has a daughter, who was born in 2014. Ainagul has a secondary education. She is involved in animal husbandry and farming and currently has 4 cows. She also grows wheat on 0.74 hectares of her own land. Her combined quarterly income amounts up to 30,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Ainagul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows for fattening up and resale. Ainagul intends to increase her livestock headcount, and the earnings from the loan will allow her to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and resale in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES HABITANTE DE CHINANDEGA ELLA CUENTA CON UNA CARNICERIA DONDE VENDE CARNE DE CERDO, FRITO,PEPENA, CHARRASCA Y MAS PRODUCTOS DERIVADOS DEL CERDO LA SEÑORA ES CASADA TIENE DOS HIJAS EN EDAD ESCOLAR LA SEÑORA VENDE DE LUNES A DOMINGO SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE.
texts.en: She lives in Chinandega and runs a butcher shop where she sells fried, ground, and cut pork and other pork products.  She is married and has two school-aged daughters.  She works seven days a week and is asking for this loan to invest into her business.  She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Zoila Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Zoila es una mujer que le gusta estar activa y tener la posibilidad de ganarse lo suyo a través de su esfuerzo, ella hace 8 años atrás surtió un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende  colas, aguas, golosinas, helados, hielo, entre otras cosas, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en el campo, el siembra maíz, maní y verduras en la época invernal y necesita actualmente para comprar abonos que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha, ella esta agradecida con la institución y a las personas que hacen posible estos créditos ya que así salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar aguas, sodas, golosinas y abono para los cultivos. Lleva 3 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank named “Las Decididas" meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. They engage in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life. They work in trade, food sales, and other business activities. 

Zoila lives in this place. She is married and has 4 children, two of which are adults and the other two are 16 and 14 years old and study at school. Three of her children live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Zoila is a woman that likes to be active and be able to earn her own salary through hard work. 8 years ago she set up a small business in her house selling cola, water, sweets, ice creams, ice, amongst other things. She will give part of her loan to her husband so that he can spend it on the fields, planting corn, peanuts and vegetables in the winter. He also currently needs to buy fertiliser that will allow him to have a good harvest. Zoila is grateful for the institution and for the people that make these loans possible as they help her move forward in life.   

Zoila is going to use this loan to buy water, soda, sweets and fertilizer for the crops. She has been with the Communal Bank for 3 years and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to provide the best possible for her children.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, sweets and fertilizer.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades económicas principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con fincas de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicado a unos metros de su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del credito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Victor espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 61 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and two children in the district of Pucará which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. In this district the main economic activities are agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

Victor works in agriculture. He has Catimore varietal coffee with plantations in good shape. they are located a few meters from his home. He also works raising cattle. He has more than 20 years experience in the business and has very good personal and work references from the area. The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops. Doing this Victor hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his clients which will have a positive impact on his level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sok Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sok Phoeun is 48 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Koh Sotin District of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children, and two of them she still supports including their school fees. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. She has been farming rice for thirty years. To better support the family, she also works as a paid worker.

This is the first loan for Sok Phoeun’s group consisting of two female members. She completely repaid the past two loans, which have improved her standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of the loan for plowing the field. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and keep sending her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Sok Heang is 43 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has four dependent children that she takes care of, and they all attend school in the local area. Rice farming is the source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for twenty-five years. To earn additional income, she also sells grocery items in her village. This is the second loan for Sok Heang. She completely repaid the first loan, which helped her improve her standard of living. She now wants to use her new loan to buy more grocery items for sell. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is 40 years old and married. She lives with her family with three dependent children in a rural area located in Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer and works as a farm worker who has been in this business for twenty-two years. 

Her group consists of three members who are all female. She is a new client who has accessed a loan with VisionFund for the first cycle. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for the farmland. With this loan, she hopes to earn more income and buy a new motorbike for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for the farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Her store earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods, condiments and other groceries which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Aside from her small store, she also has two tricycle units for transport service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Carmen dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
Crisales is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and accessories for her transport business vehicle. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from her transport service, she also makes framed cross stitch art that she sells to her friends and neighbors. She appears in the photo with her work.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts for and perform maintenance on her jeepney. It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. Part of the loan she will use to buy cross-stitch threads and frames. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help.

In the future Crisales hopes to buy another jeepney to grow her business. She prays for good health and and a better future for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her jeepney and to buy frames and cross stitch thread as well.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron is aged 64 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She has five children, and one of them is a dependent child whom she has to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for twenty years. To better support the family, she also sells Khmer noodles in her village. 

Her group consists of two members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for eight cycles already and completely paid back the loans. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy household supplies.  With this loan, she hopes to expand her current business and could earn more income.

loans.use: to buy household supplies

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
En is aged 47 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Keo Seyma district of Mondol Kiri province. She has two children and one of them is a dependent child whom she has to take care of. Cassava farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for four years.  

En’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have better living conditions. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for the farmland. She hopes to have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farmland

loans.name: Mouyeng

texts.en:
Mouyeng is aged 57 years old and divorced. She lives with her children in a rural area located in the Kompong Seam district of Kompong Cham province. She has five children to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for thirty-seven years.
  
She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. She wants to use her portion to buy a motorbike to use in her family. With this loan, She hopes to reduce on motor-taxi expenses by having a decent motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use in her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and cement for building a shed.

loans.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “Juan Pablo II” una de ellas es la Sra. Flor de María  de 32 años conviviente y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Flor de María    se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de comida en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Flor de María    ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Flor de María       trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (MENESTRAS,VERDURAS, FRUTAS, CARNES ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Flor de María   se encuentra sentada en el lado derecho y se le distingue con una blusa de color celeste (este es un color azul claro), se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
This group consists of five responsible individuals who engage in different business activities. They are the members of the Communal Bank “Juan Pablo II”.

One of the members is Flora de María. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. For the past three years, she has been selling food from a small shop every day with the intention of getting ahead and paying for her children’s schooling. With the fruits of her labor, Flor de María has been able to make improvements to her home and support her children’s education. Her greatest wish is for her children to become professionals, which is why she works hard. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise, such as stews, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other items so that she can earn more income.

In the photo, Flor de María is on the right side and wearing a light blue t-shirt. She says farewell with a hug to Kiva and EDAPROSPO. She appreciates the loan that has been issued since it will make it possible for her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy stews, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, dirt, clay, and other supplies that are used for making bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 29 years old and married. She lives with her family, including 2 children, in a rural area located in Kompong Cham province. Cassava farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 11 years. To better support the family, she also works as a worker as well.

Chanthy’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have better standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund.

As the group leader, Chanthy wants to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on hiring more plots of farmland for operating her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Her name is Marites, 49, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a carpenter, and has six children several of whom are still in school and the rest on a farm. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the everyday needs of her family.

Marites is in the fish business. She buys several quantities of various dried fish at a wholesale price and sells them at retail. Filipinos love to eat dried fish for breakfast and it is eaten best with fried rice.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day. 

To help her sustain and expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy more quantities of dried fish. She is positive and thankful to God and you for the financial help that will be given to her since it will really boost her sales and her earnings.  That is a great help in their daily sustenance and for her children's education. 

Marites aims to grow her business in the coming years. She also dreams to provide her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 49-year-old resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines and she is married to Felix. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Alma maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Alma is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business.

Alma dreams of expanding her business more and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy direct selling products she needs to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en:
Khea is 28 years old and married. She lives with her family with two dependent children in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham Province. She has been farming rice and cassava for 10 years.

Her group consists of three members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have a better standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund.

As the group leader, Khea wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farming. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokeang

texts.en:
Sokeang is aged 35 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kompong Seam district of Kompong Cham province. She has three children, all of whom are in school. To make a living, she raises cows while her husband works as a taxi driver. She has been in the current business about 15 years. 

She is a new client who has just accessed a loan with VisionFund for the first cycle. She wants to use her entire loan to buy a plot of land for building a proper house. She hopes for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for building a proper house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Srin is aged 54 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district of Kompong Cham province. She has four children. Corn farming and scarf weaving have been the main sources of her family’s income.  They have been in these businesses for 30 years. To earn additional income, she also works as a paid worker. 

Srin’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. The past loan has helped her family to have a better living condition. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy supplies for supporting her scarf weaving business. She hopes to have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for supporting her scarf weaving business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Srieng's Group

texts.en:
Srieng is 47 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Kompong Cham province. She has three dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Duck raising is the primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for twenty-nine years.  To better support the family, she also works as a construction worker

This is the fourth loan for Srieng’s group consisting of two female members. She completely repaid the past two loans, which have helped her make her living better and enough ability to support her children’s studying. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and duck feeds. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal (zinc) sheets and purlins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, and iron bar to repair and improve his small house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement blocks for repairing and improving her small house.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la crianza de animales y agricultura principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad hace 5 años y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para estos, con esto Vidalina espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Vidalina is 59-years-old, she is in a common law marriage and lives with her family in the district of Pucara, which is located in the province of Jaén, a region of Cajamarca in the northern highlands of Peru. The residents of this district make a living mainly from agriculture and raising animals. 

She is works breeding and selling small animals such as pigs, chickens, ducks, turkeys, among others. She has practiced this trade for five years and has good references from her neighbors. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of animals and food for them. By doing this, Vidalina expects to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers thereby satisfying their taste, which will allow her to increase her income level and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of animals and balanced food for them.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el ditrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. cuenta con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Maria espera tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 25, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Oyotún district.  It is a rural area located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in this community is peaceful.  The inhabitants primarily work in agriculture and commerce and raise animals.

She sells groceries like milk, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and soft drinks, etc.  She says that she has over one year of experience in the business.  She has fixed customers who give her very good personal and work references.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in order to increase the stock in her business.  This investment will serve to increase her sales, which will have a big effect on the business.  With this Maria hopes to have greater stock of products in order to be able to tend to the diverse needs and tastes of the customers in the area.  This will generate greater earnings, and it will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in order to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood in order to make furniture pieces that have been ordered.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, su esposo y su hijo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocar piso cerámico y energía eléctrica, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cerámica, cemento, arena, conexión eléctrica y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been managing a small store at her place of residence for the past four years. With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to move forward. The borrower lives in her own home along with her parents, her husband, and her son.

She wants to improve her home by installing a ceramic floor and electricity services, but she does not earn enough from her sales to pay for this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy ceramic tiles, cement, and sand. She will also pay for the electricity connection and labor. As a result, she and her family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to pay for ceramic tiles, cement, sand, an electricity connection, and labor.

loans.name: Odeh

texts.en: Odeh is a 48-year-old married man from Rafah city, where he lives with his wife and one son. He works as an employee in the public sector but earns a low income. He wants to improve his life so he decided to get a BA degree from an open university, where he registered in a commerce college. He has also requested a Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop to use for his studies. Once he gets his laptop, Odeh will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to use at school.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad con gran cantidad de ripio y piedras que la población utiliza para la construcción de viviendas, también se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas, desde hace tres años, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, María ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes como sacos de arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, entre otros, para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Cayaltí District, a community with lots of gravel and stones that people use to build homes. They also work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo Province, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband have had a general store for 3 years which offers groceries, beverages and candy. They are a united family that struggles to do their work. María has asked for a loan in order to buy more groceries such as bags of rice, sugar, flour, oil, and more to offer to her customers and in this way generate more income for her family which will have a positive impact on their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as bags of rice, sugar, flour, oil, and more, to offer her customers.

loans.name: Jose Mesias

texts.es:
Jose tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de maíz, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 62, lives in his own house, which is made of basic materials.  He lives with his wife in the Querocotillo district, which is in the Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district mainly work in agriculture and commerce and raise animals.

He is a farmer, and he grows corn.  He has 20 years of experience in the field, and he has good references in his district.

He will use the loan for agricultural work, to apply pesticides, to use fertilizers, and to pay for labor to clear weeds from his corn crop.  This will help him improve his crops both physiologically and morphologically, as well as improve their productivity. It will also help him get a timely harvest. He will have greater production and a higher quality product; thus, he will not have difficulty selling his product.  This will generate a greater income that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to apply pesticides, to use fertilizers, and to pay for labor to clear weeds from his corn crop.

loans.name: Elden Francisco

texts.es:
Elden tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la crianza de animales y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, cerdos, cuyes, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 2 años y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará a satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elden is 31-years-old, he is in a common law marriage and has a son. He lives in his own home located in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, which is a province of Chiclayo, from the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district are mainly engaged in raising animals and trade.

Elden makes a living raising and selling farmyard animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, pigs, and guinea pigs, among others. He has practiced this activity for 2 years and has good references from the residents of the area. 

He is now requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, among others, to increase his business's stock. The loan will help satisfy his customers' needs, which will generate higher revenues and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, among others, to increase his business's stock.

loans.name: Jhony Wilmer

texts.es:
Jhony, de 24 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y junto con su pareja tiene 1 hija de 3 años de edad, en su casa vive su madre y una hermana.

Jhony, se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace de casa en casa desde hace 5 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su familia, ya que ellos siempre se han dedicado a diferentes negocios, para ofrecer la ropa Jhony, camina hasta 4 kilómetros todos los días.- Con la venta de ropa, logra obtener los ingresos suficientes para el sustento diario de su familia.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, de está manera podrá surtir su negocio y podrá ofrecerles más producto a sus clientes.

El sueño de Jhony, es comprar un terreno, donde pueda construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony, 24 years old, is a farmer who studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and he and his wife have a 3-year-old daughter. His mother and his sister also live in his home.

Jhony has sold clothing door to door for the last five years. He learned this trade from his family, since they have always dedicated themselves to different businesses. To peddle clothes, Jhony walks up to four kilometers every day. By selling clothes daily, he manages to obtain sufficient income to sustain his family.

The loan Jhony is requesting from our institution will be used to purchase clothing for children, women, and gentlemen. In this manner, he will be able to restock his business and offer his customers additional products.

Jhony's dream is to buy land where he can construct a dignified house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing for children, women and gentlemen to sell.

loans.name: Edna Liliana

texts.es:
En el año 2014 con la ayuda de un amigo una mujer llamada Edna inicio por necesidad económica un negocio de venta de mercancía donde oferta ropa, productos de uso personal y accesorios en la vitrina que se puede ver en la foto.

Edna es una mujer soltera no tiene hijos, por lo que no tiene una persona que la apoye y se empezó a ver mal, cuando no encontraba trabajo y recurrir al emprendimiento según ella una excelente decisión ya que maneja sus tiempos, puede ofertar donde quiere e impulsar más sus creatividad para salir de adversidades.

Edna primeramente se está enfocando en lograr una estabilidad económica y así poder hacer que su negocio sea perdurable en el tiempo, rentable y competitivo en el mercado.

Edna solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio, comprara surtido de ropa, accesorios, perfumería, lociones, tendidos, acolchados, su idea es ir a los pueblos ofrecerles en la puerta a estas personas que necesitan hacer un largo desplazamiento para acceder a ellos y mirar que otras opciones le pueden ayudar para fortalecer sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the year 2014, with the help of a friend, out of economic necessity, a woman called Edna began a business selling merchandise where she offers clothing, personal products and accessories in the display case that you can see in the photo. 

Edna is a single woman, she doesn't have children, so she doesn't have someone who supports her and it began to look bad when she didn't find work and turning to entrepreneurship, according to her, was an excellent decision since she manages her time, can sell where she wants and boost her creativity more to get out of adversity.

Edna primarily focuses on achieving economic stability and in this way be able to make her business last in time, profitable, and be competitive in the market. 

Edna asks for a loan to stock her business, she will purchase an assortment of clothing, accessories, perfumes, lotions, bedspreads, and cushions. Her idea is to go to the towns and sell them at the door to people who need to make long trips to access them and to see what other options can help to strengthen her sales.
