loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing, accessories, perfumes, lotions, bedspreads, and cushions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: JENNY: Es una mujer simpática de 39 años de edad, vive en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casada con 4 hijos.: El mayor de 17 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria, 2 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y secundaria respectivamente y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco desde hace 8 años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda de madera y concreto. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar las bases de madera, ya que están deterioradas y comprar materiales de construcción: Bloque, cemento, hierro, zinc, madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su esposo sueñan con tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones necesarias para vivir de manera digna y segura.
texts.en:
Jenny is a nice woman who is 39 years old. She lives in Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is married with four children. The oldest, who is 17, is in the first year of university. Two teenagers are in primary and secondary school, and she has a small three year old.

She has begun replacing the wooden base supports of her wooden house with a heavy base support through great effort over the last eight years, little by little. She is asking for financing in order to change the wood bases that are deteriorated and buy supplies: blocks, cement, iron, zinc, wood, nails, and to cover labor costs. She and her husband dream of having a home that will provide what is necessary to live in a dignified and secured manner.
.

loans.use: to buy supplies to change the wooden base supports of her home to concrete supports

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme divorcée de 48 ans et vit avec quatre enfants à Adidogmé. Pour couvrir ses charges et faire face aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants, Adjowa vend des pagnes en se promenant dans les quartiers. Adjowa s’approvisionne une fois par mois dans un marché local de Lomé. Pour augmenter sa rentabilité, Adjowa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des pagnes pour équiper son étagère et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en: Adjowa is a 48 year old, divorced woman and lives with her four children in Adidogmé. To cover her costs and to face her children's daily needs, Adjowa sells pagnes by walking through neighborhoods. Adjowa stocks up once a month at the local market in Lomé. In order to increase her profits, Adjowa needs this loan to buy pagnes to stock up her shelf and to fulfill her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy some pagne cloths

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Abra est une jeune fille célibataire sans enfant qui vit à Adidogomé. Abra est très dynamique et ne dépend de personne pour pourvoir à ses besoins quotidiens. Pour assurer ses charges, Abra vend des produits de beauté et des chaussures de bonne marque dans le quartier et réalise un revenu favorable. Abra s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Pour acheter des déodorants et des parfums, Abra sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et pourvoir efficacement à ses besoins
texts.en: Abra, age 32, is a young single woman without children who lives in Adidogomé. Abra is very dynamic and does not depend on anyone to provide  for her daily needs. In order to take care of these needs, Abra sells beauty products and brand-name shoes in the neighborhood and has favorable earnings. Abra stocks up at the market twice a month. To buy deodorants and perfumes, Abra is requesting this micro loan to achieve her goals and to efficiently fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to buy 10 deodorants and 22 perfumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, ella es empleada, está cursando el 1° año de Postgrado Integrado de Psicología.
Ella quiere seguir aumentando su conocimiento, es por ello que se esfuerza, ya que quiere abrirse camino en el mundo profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de postgrado. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Maria is studying and working at the same time. She is employed and is attending the first year of Graduate School in Psychology. She wants to continue increasing her knowledge. For this reason, she works hard in order to succeed in the professional world. She is requesting a loan to pay for graduate school expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay for graduate school expenses.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants" Mbamtaré 2" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE « Epouses des enseignants » « Mbamtaré 2 », regroupent des femmes enseignantes et/ou dont les maris sont enseignants. Ce rassemblement est né il y a quelques années et les activités divergent selon les membres.
La présidente s’appelle Khadidiatou, elle est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants âgés respectivement de 14 et 12 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus, bijoux et vaisselle et a acquis une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Elle a une clientèle régulière qui d’habitude fait sa commande avant qu’elle ne parte acheter sa marchandise. Khadidiatou n’a pas de charges car elle est entièrement pris en charge par son époux enseignant. Avec le bénéfice de l’activité, elle met un peu d’argent de coté pour pouvoir réaliser son rêve le plus cher qui est celui de pouvoir voyager à travers le monde pour importer des containers de marchandises développer son commerce.
texts.en:
The GIE "Epouses des enseignants" "MMbamtaré 2," is a group of women who are teachers and/or whose husbands are teachers. This group was started a few years ago and the activities vary among members. 

The president of the group is named Khadidiatou. She is 33 years old, married and a mother of two children aged 14 and 12 respectively. Her business consists of selling fabrics, jewelry and dishes, and she has gained two years of experience in this domain. She has a regular customer-base who usually place their orders before she leaves to buy her merchandise. 

Khadidiatou does not have any expenses to cover because she is completely covered by her husband who is a teacher. From her business profits, she puts some money aside to be able to achieve her biggest dream which is to be able to travel around the world to import containers of merchandise for developing her trade.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, jewelry and dishes to resell.

loans.name: Karla Ivonne

texts.en:
Karla is 37 years old, is unmarried and lives with her family. In addition to giving therapy at home, she sells accessories such as jewelry, purses, handbags, and agendas. 
Karla would like to open a boutique in the coming months to increase her sales and generate higher income to provide for her parents. 
Karla seeks to overcome the challenges that arise each day in order to pursue her dream. Once she has a more formal and well-established business, she would like to run a foundation to support the poor. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to purchase jewelry and invest in plated gold and imitation jewelry. This is Karla’s first loan with Konfío and she is very committed to make successful repayments.

loans.use: to buy imitation and gold-plated jewelry wholesale for her shop.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Snoul district of Kratie province, Lin is aged 34 years and married. She has one kid. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice, and buying and selling cashew nuts in her local area. To supplement the income she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 84,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Lin has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she has successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is going to ask for another loan to buy more cashew nuts for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Battambang province, Tuy is a 52-year-old married father of four children, three of whom are dependent on him and still in school. Pig raising and rubber growing have been the main sources of his family’s income for 15 years.

Tuy has been with VisionFund for two cycles and now he is applying for a loan to pay his son's tuition fee to study the English language. He hopes to keep his son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of hog finishing feed and animal vitamins.

Aside from her project of building additional concrete pigpens, she thought of adding more head of pigs and working on swine production for good breeding piglets. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of hog finishing feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their land, planting corn and vegetables in Macasing, Pagadian, in the Philippines. She has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the farmland is ready for planting. Emiliana knew that she had to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Emiliana hopes to buy a motor cab for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°21"fonk Art Bi" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants » Fonk art bi », rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
La responsable du groupe s’appelle Germaine, elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants dont son ainé un garçon âgé de 20 ans. Germaine vend du poisson : elle part au port attendre les pécheurs pour ensuite marchander avec eux afin d’obtenir un prix abordable. Elle a démarré à petit échelle et son désir serait de devenir un grand fournisseur de poisson dans les régions qui voient rarement du poisson frais.
texts.en:
This GIE "Epouses des enseignants" "Fonk art bi" is a group of female teachers and/or wives of teachers who are in the trade business. They have gathered together as a network for solidarity as well as to be able to benefit from the financing more easily. This is their first time asking for a loan with IMCEC. 

The one in charge of the group is named Germaine. She is 46 years old, married and a mother of three children, the oldest boy is 20 years old. Germaine sells fish. She goes to the port to wait for the fishermen then bargains with them to reach an affordable price. She has started on a small scale and her dream would be to become a major fish supplier in regions that rarely see fresh fish.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in selling pozzolana (cement material) and at the same time selling bananas that adds more income. He is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital that hinders the progress of his business. Joseph needs a loan to pay for labor in his pozallana business.

loans.use: to pay for labor in  his pozallana business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and meal

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.ru: Зулайка, 24 года, замужем, есть сын 2014 года рождения. Образование у Зулайки среднее. Она занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На участке мерою 1,84 Га собственной земли, она выращивает кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Прибыль Зулайки составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS) в квартал. Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник дохода и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от бизнеса Зулайка будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие, чтобы иметь возможность достроить ее дом.
texts.en:
Zulaika is 24 years old, married and has one son, who was born in 2014. Zulaika has received secondary education. She is engaged in farm work—raising livestock and growing crops. Zulaika has two cows. On her own land plot of 1.84 ha [4.5 acres], she grows corn and clover for own use and sale. Zulaika’s quarterly revenue reaches up to 30,000 KGS. 

Zulaika decided to expand her farming business since this is her only source of income, and applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy three cows for fattening and resale. Zulaika plans to invest the revenues in a further development of her business so as to be able to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows for fattening up and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Perline

texts.fr:
Perline est une femme mariée de 48 ans qui a eu 3 enfants. Elle est originaire de la campagne et est venue s’installer en ville dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe pour démarrer une nouvelle activité et monter sa propre épicerie.

Son partenariat avec Vahatra a débuté il y 3 ans. Elle ne vendait au début que quelques produits (bonbons, gâteaux et quelques légumes) et essaye aujourd’hui de diversifier sa marchandise. Grâce à ce nouveau prêt, elle compte améliorer son épicerie en offrant un choix plus important d’articles. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter des produits de première nécessité comme de l’huile, du sucre, du riz et des œufs qu’elle proposera ensuite à ses clients.

Perline espère, à moyen terme, pouvoir construire sa propre maison et ainsi contribuer à sécuriser l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Perline is a 48-year old married woman with three children. She is from the countryside and has recently moved to town, to the urban community of Antsirabe, in order to launch a new business and open her own grocery store.

She started her collaboration with Vahatra three years ago. Initially she  used to sell only a limited selection of products (candy, pastries and some vegetables) and now she tries to diversify her merchandise. Thanks to this new loan, she plans to improve her store by offering a greater selection of products. She would like to buy staple items such as oil, sugar, rice and eggs to sell to her customers. Perline’s medium-term objective is to be able to build her own house and in this way help provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy staple foods such as rice, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Felana

texts.fr:
Felana est une jeune femme plein d'initiative. Elle est âgée de 27 ans et vit avec son mari et son enfant dans une commune rurale située à 20 kilomètres d'Antsirabe. Elle est locataire d'une petite maison en dure où elle a aménager un espace pour construire une porcherie.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus de 2 ans ou elle a obtenu plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. Elle a ainsi pu démarrer une activité d'élevage porcin destinés à la vente. Une fois engraissé, ses porcs sont livrés dans une ville de bord de mer. Au retour, Felana achète du poisson séché qu'elle vend à son tour sur les hauts plateaux malgache, dans la région d'Antsirabe.

Ce prêt ddoit lui permettre d'acquérir plusieurs porcelets et de pouvoir ainsi développer son actvité. Elle a également besoin de farine alimentaire destinée à l'engraissement. Elle vous remercie avec son plus beau sourire pour votre soutien.
texts.en:
Felana is a young woman with a lot of initiative. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and child in a rural commune which lies 20 kilometers from Antsirabe. She rents a small rigid house which she has rearranged to create a space to build a pigpen. 

She has been a partner of Vahatra for more than two years and has had several successive loans, each one being for a larger amount. She has thus been able to start up an activity raising pigs to sell on. Once she has fattened them up, her pigs are delivered to a town on the coast. When she returns, Felana buys dried fish which she in turn sells on the high Madagascan plains in the region of Antsirabe.

This loan will enable her to buy several piglets and thus build up her business. She also needs flour to use for fattening up the pigs. She thanks you all with her lovliest smile for your support.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fattening flour.

loans.name: Louisette

texts.fr:
Louisette est une femme énergique. Elle est âgé de 41 ans et est mariée. Elle a eu 4 garçons qui lui demandent beaucoup de travail. Elle est propriétaire d'une petite maison en dure dans un quartier semi rural de la commune d'Antsirabe.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus de 3 ans, où elle a obtenu plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. Elle a pu développer une petite épicerie devant son domicile qui lui assure un revenu plus régulier que les activités agricoles ou d'élevage.

Ce prêt devrait lui permettre d'augmenter son capital et d'acheter en gros des marchandises pour les besoins quotidiens, comme le sucre, le riz de l'huile, du savon. Son projet de vie c'est d'acquérir une autonomie financière et de faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Louisette is a dynamic woman. She is 41 years old and is married. She has 4 boys who demand a lot of work from her. She is the owner of a small hard house in a semi-rural neighborhood of the commune of Antsirabe. 

She has been a partner of Vahatra for more than 3 years, where she has obtained several successive loans of an increasing amount. She was able to develop a small grocery store in front of her home that assures her a more regular income than agriculture or livestock farming.  

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and to buy wholesale merchandise for the daily needs, such as sugar, rice, oil, soap. Her life plan is to acquire self-sufficient financing and to face up to the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy essential products such as sugar, rice, soap

loans.name: Landolo Group

texts.fr: Fati est la responsable du groupe Landolo. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 à l'école. Sa première fille a 16 ans, son deuxième 13 ans et le dernier n'a que 4 ans.Cette brave dame vend du dolo et de la soupe, il y'a plus de 10 ans. Le dolo c'est une boisson faite à partir du sorgho rouge(mil) rouge. Fati a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter le sorgho, du bois pour la cuisson, de l'eau et tout autre ingrédient nécessaire pour la préparation du dolo. En plus de cela, elle pourra acheter de la viande aussi pour préparer la soupe vendre. Cette brave compte renforcer ses activités à l'avenir. A l'issue de ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer ses activités et de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fati is in charge of the Landolo group. She is married and a mother of 3 children, 2 of which go to school. Her first daughter is 16 years old, her second is 13 years old and her last one is 4 years old. This brave woman has been selling dolo and soup for over 10 years. Dolo is a drink made from red sorgho (millet).

Fati needs this loan to purchase sorgho, wood for cooking, water and any other ingredients necessary for preparing dolo. In addition, she will be able to buy meat to make soup to sell. This courageous woman expects to strengthen her business in the future. From her sales, her profit will allow her to continue her business activities and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sorgho (millet) to make dolo (a local Burkina drink) and to pay for meat for preparing soup to sell.

loans.name: Nirina Adeline

texts.fr:
Nirina Adeline est une jeune femme qui a décidé de faire face à ces difficultés. A 40 ans, elle élève seule son petit garçon tout en développant une activité d'épicerie. 

Cela fait maintenant plus de 2 ans qu'elle est partenaire de Vahatra chez qui elle a obtenu plusieurs prêts successif d'un montant croissant. Elle a pu démarrer et développer une petite épicerie à côté de son domicile.

Ce prêt devrait lui permettre d'augmenter son capital et son chiffre d'affaire et de gagner ainsi en autonomie. Son objectif à long terme c'est de pouvoir assurer du mieux possible l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Nirina Adeline is a young woman who decided to face up to her problems. At 40 years old, she raises her young boy alone while developing a grocery store. 

It’s now more than 2 years that she has been a partner of Vahatra, where she obtained several successive loans of an increasing amount. She was able to start and develop a small grocery story next to her home. 

This loan should permit her to increase her capital and her revenue, and thus to gain autonomy.  Her long-term objective is to be able to assure the best possible education for her child.

loans.use: to buy staple food products such as rice, sugar, salt, oil

loans.name: Adeline Jeanne

texts.fr:
Adeline Jeanne est une femme courageuse. Elle est âgée de 44 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants dans un quartier périphérique de la commune d'Antsirabe. Elle exerce la difficile activité de vente de commerçante ambulante.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus de 1 an où elle a pu obtenir plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. Elle a ainsi pu sortir de la sous traitance et acquérir son propre capital pour exercer une activité de vente ambulante de vêtements d'occasion dans les villages alentours. Ce travail nécessite ainsi de long déplacement à pied.

Avec ce prêt, Adeline Jeanne souhaite acheter 4 balles de friperie, ce qui devrait lui permettre d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et ses bénéfices. A long terme son projet c'est d'acquérir une autonomie financière et sociale.
texts.en:
Adeline Jeanne, age 44, is a brave woman who lives with her husband and their three children in a district on the outskirts of the Antsirabe commune. She is an itinerant vendor, which is a very demanding activity. 

Adeline Jeanne has been a member of Vahatra for over one year during which she has obtained several successive loans of increasing amounts. This has allowed her to quit being a sub-contractor and acquire her own capital to invest in her activity of itinerant sales of used clothing in surrounding villages. This work requires a lot of walking.  

Adeline Jeanne will use this loan to purchase four bales of used clothing. This should help to bolster both her sales and her profits. 

Her long term goal is to become financially and socially independent.

loans.use: to stock up on used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mariette

texts.fr:
Mariette est une femme de la campagne. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée avec 1 enfant. Elle vit dans un quartier rural de la commune d'Antsirabe. Ses parents était originaire de la campagne où elle a grandit. Elle est locataire d'une petite maison en terre.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 3 ans où elle a obtenu plusieurs prêts successif d'un montant croissant. Grâce à ces crédit elle a pu démarrer et développer une activité d'élevage porcins.

Avec ce crédit, Mariette souhaite agrandir son cheptel en achetant 4 porcelets supplémentaires ainsi qu'un stock de farine alimentaire pour les nourrir. A long terme son projet c'est d'acheter un terrain et d'y construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mariette is a rural dweller. She is 41 years old, married and has one child. She lives in a rural area of the Antsirabe community. Her parents were from the village where she grew up. She is renting a small clay house.

Mariette has been collaborating with Vahatra for three years now. She obtained multiple loans in increasingly higher amounts. Thanks to this loans, she was able to launch and develop her pig-raising business.

With this loan, Mariette would like to increase the size of her livestock by buying four additional piglets and stocking up on animal feed for them.  Her long-term  goal is to buy a land plot and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: 1 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
1 de Noviembre se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, con la unión de 17 mujeres, todas y cada una de ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, que quieren salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona que se destaca en este grupo es la Sra. Victorina, quien hace comidas ella misma, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Poco a poco se ha hecho conocida, y es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Victorina quiere ir creciendo, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 1 de Noviembre group was formed  in the city of Caaguazú, with the coming together of 17 women, each and every one of them very hard-working and close-knit as a group, who want to succeed and help one another. They are participating in the poverty elimination program, which will allow them to improve their living conditions. 

One person who stands out in this group is Victorina, who makes meals on her own and afterwards goes out to sell them as a street vendor. She is very good at what she does. Little by little she has become well known,  and that is why she already has a good clientele. Victorina wants to continue growing, and that it is why she is asking for this loan so that she can buy supplies for making her meals,  such as vegetables, meat, condiments and other ingredients. She is grateful for the help she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas quieren mejorar sus vidas por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
Una persona que es digna de mencionar es la Sra. Julia, quien es la tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y con ese trabajo se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo y trabajo duro está luchando por abrirse camino.
Julia pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, pantalones, camisas, entre otras cosas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" group is in their first loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. It is a new group where all the members want to improve their lives through their joint efforts.

One person worthy of mentioning is Julie who is the treasurer of the group. She works selling a variety of clothing and with this work she is making an effort to improve her income. She is a hard-working woman who with her effort and hard work she is struggling to move forward. Julia is requesting this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, pants, shirts, amongst other things to continue with her sales, struggling to improve her life conditions and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, shirts, amongst other things.

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil is a 19-year-old single man from Ramallah City. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Emil is a university student where he studies accounting. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the family living conditions.
Emil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.Bby taking this loan, Emil will be able to do his homework and reports easily.
Emil appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 32-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Reham is a university student where she studies health science. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.
Reham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Reham will be able to do her homework and reports easily.
Reham appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 35-year-old married father of two sons and two daughters from Jenin City. Samer sometimes in construction where he gets a low income. Samer also has a farm where he plants seasonal crops. 
Samer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seed and seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Samer will be able to increase the farm's productivity and also his income. 
Samer appears in the photo in his farm

loans.use: to buy seed and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 30-year-old married father of two sons and one daughter from Jenin City. Salem sometimes works in construction where he gets a low income. Salem also has a farm where he plants seasonal crops. 
Salem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seed and seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Salem will be able to increase the farm's productivity and also his income. 
Salem appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase feed and hogs for his piggery business. His piggery earnings helped support his family and he was able to buy a tricycle (shown in the above photo) and a small general store.

Noel would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy grocery items, fuel for his tricycle and feed for his piggery business. He thanks God and you in advance for a good return on his investments and the financial help that will be given him for it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Noel believes his dreams for more businesses are becoming a reality. He aims to have a better future and save for his future kids. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fuel for his tricycle and pay for additional hogs, crabs, and vegetables needed to operate his businesses.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ismail has a farm where he plants seasonal crops. He sells the crops in the local market.

Ismail took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm. By taking this loan, Ismail will be able to increase the farm productivity and also his income. Ismail appears in the photo in his farm

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Marcelo is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Marcelo works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s wishes. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines, as well as hand-stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Marcelo is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Marcelo is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 15,000 PHP loan to start his own business, buying and selling different kinds of merchandise, for additional income.

Marcelo wants for his children to complete their schooling and have a better future. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Marcelo before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to start a business of buying and selling different kinds of merchandise.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses. who is aged thirty-two is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in cattle, supplemented by milk sales for extra income. This is a business he started so as to meet his family needs. Moses intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell ahead of the Easter season. He is a determined man who desires to build a permanent house for his family even though he is challenged by inadequate capital and the prolonged dry spell affecting pasture growth for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans et vit à Ségbé avec ses deux enfants. Akouavi est une femme dynamique et cherchant l’épanouissement de sa famille, elle vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier  et gagne bien sa vie dans ce commerce. Akouavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. En sollicitant ce crédit, Akouavi veut commander des sacs de charbons de bois afin d’avoir plus de bénéfice et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouavi is a married woman, 51 years old and lives in Ségbé with her two children. Akouavi is a dynamic woman who is trying to help her family flourish. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood and makes a good living from this trade. Akouavi stocks up three times a month from her suppliers. By requesting this loan, Akaouvi would like to order bags of charcoal in order to be able to increase her profits and to promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 21 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega, a 57-year-old married mother of eight, wants to start a small business making and selling a variety of handicrafts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy rolls of pandanus leaves, empty boxes, paint, brushes. a set of carving knives and rolls of material. 

In the future, Faalupega hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of pandanus leaves, empty boxes, paint, brushes. a set of carving knives and rolls of material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees for her university and enrollment.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y poder seguir con sus estudios. El esta agradecido por la oportunidad que ha recibido, ya que así podrá estar cada vez mas cerca de sus metas.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Andres is working hard to get ahead. He says that he used his previous loan to pay his university fees and continue with his studies. He is grateful for the opportunity which he has been given because he will be able to get closer and closer to achieving his goals. 

He is now applying for a loan to invest in the payment of his fees so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, a 45-year-old married mother of one child who is in school, works very hard to provide for her family. She  has been running a general store in the Philippines for a year, and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 48 years old and married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Irene has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF once in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She does business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending. Letecia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like clothes, home care products, etc. for her dry goods business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like clothes, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
As a  parent of one child, Genevie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Genevie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Genevie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 27 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for two years.

Marilou has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, and is now requesting a PHP 5000 loan to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, a 54-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for two years now. Marina, who received a previous loan, has requested a new one for PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, such as a hair-washing sink, hair dryer, shampoo and massage and beauty products.

loans.name: Argen

texts.en:
Argen is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“The main thing for a person is the right profession. I want to become a lawyer. To get a high quality education, I enrolled at AUCA, department of International and Business Law. I think that is the most prestigious university in Central Asia which has American system of studies. In the future, when I become a highly qualified lawyer, I want to help people in my country. The moral satisfaction from daily work is a highest salary which isn’t measured by monetary units. Being a true lawyer is to be an expert with the high qualified education. AUCA is one of the universities that give good opportunities for studies and even financial aid to all its students. I am not able to cover all my tuition fees; therefore I am applying for a Kiva loan, which will be of much help to me.

I am 18 years old and I live with my parents in the south of Kyrgyzstan. My father is a principle of one of the schools in my town and my mother is a teacher at the university there. Despite that fact that they are budgetary workers and earn little, they love their profession and contribute in the future of the youth. From my childhood they used to cultivate in me a good education. They tried to give me the best education and tutored at home. Thanks to them I could study and count at the early childhood. Now my parents are facing hard times and I am asking for a 1 100 USD loan for my higher education tuition fees. I thank lenders for their attention and await for your loan.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 23-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Filomena needs a loan to buy bags of taro, a stack of bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a gas burner, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also to maintain the well-being of her children. Filomena has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of taro, a stack of bananas, a barrel of cooking oil, a gas burner, and plastic bags

loans.name: Faranisisi

texts.en: Faranisisi is 39 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store where she sells a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year, and has requested a loan to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and a sack of onions and potatoes. Faranisisi hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado divino niño jesus  está en su ciclo número 18º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Paricia.
Ella entre el trabajo que hace cuenta que realiza manualidades y tiene una heladería en su casa, también se debe destacar el trabajo que hace la fundación paraguaya, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Patricia Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de helados varios, para que con ello pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group called "divino niño jesus" is in its 18th cycle on the Women's Committee program, where all of the members work and help each other in order to get ahead. They are a part of the program to eliminate poverty and one of the group's members is Patricia.

Patricia makes crafts and also runs an ice cream shop from her house. Another thing that should be highlighted is the work that the fundación paraguaya does. They are continuously following up on the training and verification of group members, which in some way requires and at the same time incentivizes the women to fight in order to be able to overcome poverty. 
 
Patricia is asking for this loan to buy various ice creams so that she can continue to sell ice cream as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that will allow her to carry on working.

loans.use: To buy ice creams to later sell.

loans.name: Leofao

texts.en: Leofao is 41 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years, and has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. Leofao has been a member of SPBD since 2011 and will use the profits she earns to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en:
Faleala is a 45-year-old widow with five children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has seven years of experience with this business.

Faleala needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faleala has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and new goggles

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en:
Tuamasaga is 54 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years.

Tuamasaga needs a loan to buy a machete, chemicals, a spade, a crowbar, crops, a wheelbarrow, and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Tuamasaga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machete, chemicals, a spade, a crowbar, crops, a wheelbarrow, and boots

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en:
Faalua is a 21-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Faalua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and also to help renew her family's home. Faalua has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast

loans.name: Salani

texts.en:
Salani is 38 years old and married with 10 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for two years.

Salani has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income.

Mohammad is a student in a local collage where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his study and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 26-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a farmer on his agricultural land.

Hani is a student in a local college where he studies elementary education. He wants to complete his study and find a job to improve the family’s living conditions.

Hani took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Hani appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Amigas y está en su 25 ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo bastante unido y trabajador donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual ayudan a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación de pobreza extrema, que trata de mejorar a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de prendas que hace lucha cada día por poder crecer. Es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y mejorar.
Julia pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Las Amigas group is in its 25th cycle under the women's communal bank program. This is quite a close-knit group, where all are putting their best effort into being able to grow, and improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are participating in the poverty elimination program, through which they are helping their loved ones. 

One of the members is Julia, who in the survey showed a level of poverty within level one, which means that she is in a situation of extreme poverty, that she is trying to improve through effort and constant work and by means of the sale of clothing which she does each day, striving to grow. She is a very self-sacrificing person who wants to move forward in life and improve.

Julia is requesting this loan so that she can buy articles of clothing to sell such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and other items, so that she can continue selling as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and other items.

loans.name: Villa Itaipu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa Itaipu forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Neide quien se encuentra en un nivel uno, de acuerdo a su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza. Ella tiene una peluquería que monto con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, ya tiene una clientela bien formada que se ha formado con mucho trabajo.
Neide pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras y otras. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Villa Itaipu."  It is part of the Poverty Elimination Program at Fundacion Paraguaya.  All of the members of this group are taking the poverty elimination survey so that they can improve their lives.

One of the members is Neide, who was found to be at poverty level one according to the Poverty Elimination Survey.  She has a beauty salon that she started up with a lot of sacrifice and effort.  Now she has a good customer base that she has managed to develop with a lot of work.

Neide is requesting a loan to invest in supplies for her salon, such as hair coloring agents, creams, shampoo, rinses, scissors, and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to grow her business and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, creams, shampoo, rinses, scissors, and other supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking and diligent mother.

She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more produce which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruit & vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: Rubelyn is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-selling business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more items to sell. Rubelyn has been in this business for two years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Letecia has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.

Lourdes is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy products to sell through her beverage business, like coconut wine, soft drinks, and other beverages.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy products to sell, like coconut wine, soft drinks, and other beverages

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 51 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell, including canned goods, beverages, home product care items and other groceries. Marissa has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sidfida Group

texts.fr: Rasmata, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 10 ans scolarisé. Elle a comme activité la restauration et cela depuis 2005, soit 10 ans. Elle préparer du riz, du spaguetti et du tô, un plat burkinabé pour vendre. Elle a besoin de ce crédit  pour s’approvisionner en riz, spaguetti, de la farine de maïs et en condiments pour faire son  repas et vendre. Elle ambitionne d'agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en:
Rasmata, the group leader, is married and the mother of a ten year old child who attends school. She has had a catering business since 2005, ten years. She prepares rice, spaghetti and tô - a dish typical to Burkina Faso - to sell. She needs this loan to buy rice, spaghetti and cornflour as well as condiments to make and sell her dishes.
Her ambition is to develop her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, spaghetti and cornflour to prepare dishes for sale.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a 51-year-old widow with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Mele needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Mele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, and crops

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va is 27 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small flea market, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year.

Va needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, and Samoan-designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, and Samoan-designed caps

loans.name: Meni

texts.en:
Meni is 36 years old and single with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Meni needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a machete, and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Meni will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a machete, and new boots

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 39 years old and divorced with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years.

Telesia needs a loan to buy new sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, overalls, and two machetes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Telesia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, overalls, and two machetes

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Bendecidas (Blessed Women). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work. 

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her 13th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaying her previous loans and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she sells chicken. She runs a butcher shop to distribute chicken daily to other minor sellers and to neighbors. She will use this loan to buy hundreds of live chicken to raise and sell. Jaqueline's group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Pasos Firmes Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the presidents of the group called Pasos Firmes (Firms Steps). This group is formed by Haitian immigrants and Haitian descendents located in El Seibo, a rural city surrounded with mountains and a river. It is one of the cities in the Dominican Republic where the agricultural activities are the main economic resources. 

Ana makes her home here in a simple structure with her six children and her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her family.

Ana is excited to be taking her 19th loan with Esperanza. She has paid off her previous loans successfully since she took her first one almost ten years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables, like banana, sweet potatoes, plantains, papayas, oranges, tomatoes and also some meats like chicken, to sell them in her fruit and vegetables stall next to her home. She will use the profits to support her children, while also reinvesting during her loan cycle. 

She is dreaming of having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buying fruits and vegetables and also meat to sell in her fruit and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
She is Liza. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had helped her business. She was able to buy more groceries and supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will lend her an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional supplies of groceries, beverages and toiletries she needs to improve her business. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Liza wants to improve her family's present financial condition and she hopes to grow her business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Télé

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Télé est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant vivant ensemble à Adidogomé. Pour soutenir sa famille Télé vend des sachets plastiques et du sucre au marché. Télé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et réalise assez de rentabilité dans son activité. Pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses clients, Télé désire ce prêt pour commander des sachets plastiques et des sacs de sucre afin d’avoir plus de rentabilité.
texts.en:
34 years old, Télé is a married woman and the mother of one child living together with her family in Adidogomé. To support her family, Télé sells plastic bags and sugar at the market. She buys her supplies twice a month at the market and makes a reasonable profit from this venture.
To meet the demand from her customers, Télé wants this loan to order plastic bags and bags of sugar, in order to increase her profitability.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of sugar and three packs of small bags, plus seven dozen large bags.

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: Massa est une femme mariée de 50 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses trois enfants qui Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de la famille, Massa vend des charbons de bois pour avoir une rentabilité considérable. Massa s’approvisionne auprès de ses fournisseurs deux fois par mois. Massa demande ce crédit pour financer l’achat des sacs de charbons de bois et ainsi faire plus de bénéfice et assurer une bonne éducative à ses enfants
texts.en: Massa is a 50 year old married woman living in Adidogomé with her three children. In order to help support the family, Massa sells charcoal to generate a considerable profit. She buys her supplies twice a month from her suppliers. Massa is requesting this loan to pay for the purchase of sacks of charcoal, to increase her profits and to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 13 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Satornina

texts.en:
Satornina is 59 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock.

Satornina has been raising pigs for five years and also earns income from abaca weaving. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme veuve âgée de 58 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Afi habite avec ses quatre enfants et ne se fatigue pas à travailler pour l’épanouissement de sa famille. Afi vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier pour trouver son gain. Afi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché où elle achète son stock à des coûts favorables. Pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer ses achats et tirer une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Afi is a 58 year old widow living in Adidogomé. Afi lives with her four children and never tires of working to support her family. She sells charcoal in her local area to provide her income. 
Afi buys her supplies three times per month at the market, where she gets good prices. In order to order sacks of charcoal, Afi is requesting this loan to finance the purchase, and to make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 55 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalina has been farming rice for 32 years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants" Bamtaré N°22" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
Madame Khady, est la responsable du groupe, elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle travaille dans le secteur appelé zone » xeelcom » où le poisson est mis dans des fours pour être fumé, puis traité par les femmes avant d’être commercialisés en gros.  Compte tenue de son expérience dans le domaine, la dame Khady bénéficie d’une notoriété dans cette zone, elle est même accompagnée par deux de ses enfants qui l’aident dans le travail pour être plus productive. Avec les recettes, elle participe à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Vu son âge, la dame Khady souhaiterait avoir les moyens d’acquérir un four pour pouvoir le louer et laisser ses enfants continuer dans la vente du poisson fumé.
texts.en:
The group "Epouses des enseignants", gathers together teachers and/or teachers' wives who have trading businesses. They have grouped themselves as a network in order to stick together, but also to gain easier access to financing. This is the first time they are requesting a loan from IMCEC.
Khady is the group leader, she has been in business for over twenty years. She works in the "xeelcom" zone - where fish is placed into ovens to be smoked, and then processed by the women prior to being sold wholesale. Based on her experience in this activity, Khady has gained respect in the area, and she is even assisted by two of her children who help with the work to increase productivity.
With the income, she helps finance the family's living expenses. Given her age, Khady would like to have the means to buy an oven, in order to be able to rent it out and to leave her children to continue the sales of the smoked fish.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas 4 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is one of the members of the “Mujeres Virtuosas (Virtuous Women) 4" Group, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. Their principal economic activities are the sale of food, grocery stores, miscellaneous sales and clothing. 

Ramona is a single mother of four children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her home. Her favorite activity is to walk and to watch television.

Ramona is very moved by receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for around ten years. She set up her business with her savings. She became successful through her own initiative for creating income and being useful. 

She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase a refrigerator to start selling soda and natural juices in a small cafeteria she recently opened. She also will invest in her main business, which is miscellaneous products sales, like clothes, underwear and jewels.

She plans to use her profits to save because she is planning to finish building her house, which is one of her short-term dreams: to live in a comfortable house and to provide her children with everything they need. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for selling soda and natural juices, and also to buy clothes, underwear and other miscellaneous products for resale.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Source for Development) 3 Group. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural, but is a great natural escape, and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town. 

Juana is a mother of three children and they live together with her and her long-term partner in her simple and rural home structure. Juana is very excited to be receiving her ninth loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business almost 12 years ago with a hair dryer that her mother bought for her and after her brother-in-law gave her 300 USD, and she started her beauty salon on her mother's balcony. Now, with Esperanza's loans and her savings, she has a nice beauty salon in her own location. 

She will invest her new loan in purchasing a hair washer and some hair products. With this investment, she will provide better services to her clients. She will use her earnings to reinvest and to keep growing the business and her improve her family's living conditions, while she saves to have a successful and sustainable business. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a hair washer and hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une jeune femme célibataire avec un enfant. Kossiwa vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 48 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Kossiwa est une revndeuse de charbons de bois. Kossiwa arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenu. Pour vendre efficacement, Kossiwa achète deux fois par mois son stock. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois afin de réaliser plus de profits.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a young single woman with one child. Kossiwa lives in Adidogomé and is 48 years old. In order to make money, she sells charcoal - she is able to meet her living expenses thanks to this income generating business.
In order to sell effectively, Kossiwa replenishes her stock twice a month. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase sacks of charcoal, to generate increased profits.

loans.use: to purchase twelve sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 67 years old now. She is married.

Conchita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for raising her livestock.

Conchita has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising livestock.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 27 years old with two children. With one child in school, Edna works very hard to provide for her family.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for sale in her general store, like home care products, canned goods, candies and other groceries.

Edna has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like home care products, canned goods, candies and other groceries.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 55 years old and married with four children. Eleuteria works very hard to provide for them.

Eleuteria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items that she can sell in her general store, like coffee, soap, home care products and groceries.

Eleuteria has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items that she can sell in her general store, like coffee, soap, home care products and groceries.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 57 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Esperanza is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for raising her livestock.

Esperanza has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising livestock.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla habite à Adidogomé. Elle est une femme célibataire sans enfant et âgée de 28 ans. Pour faire face aux charges quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve, Abla vend des mèches et des produits de beauté. Cette activité lui permet  d’avoir un revenu lui permettant de se nourrir. Abla s’approvisionne trois fois par mois pour avoir son stock. Abla demande ce crédit pour acheter des mèches, des tissages et des postiches d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour avoir un bon épanouissement.
texts.en:
Abla lives in Adidogomé. She is a 28 year old single woman with no children. In order to meet her living expenses, she sells hair extensions and beauty products. This business gives her sufficient income to feed herself. She buys her supplies three times a month to maintain a stock.
Abla is requesting this loan to buy hair extensions, braids and hairpieces - this will allow her to generate an income to be able to live properly.

loans.use: to buy 30 hair extensions, 20 braids and 30 hairpieces.

loans.name: Harishankar Group

texts.en:
Dhabala Damayanti, age about 49, is a unique lady in the Muniguda village. Dhabala Damayanti has a small family comprising her husband and only one daughter and son. She has engaged herself in a fish business at her own home in Muniguda. She is the fourth person from the left hand side, standing in the front row.

Also, she is an ideal member of her village Self-Help Group (SHG), namely Harishankar, which was formed in the year 2011 and contains twelve members. As part of the SHG, they all are engaged with their own professions and businesses. Mrs. Dhabala Damayanti is one of them who has taken a great role to play, with an object to improve their livelihoods and professional lives.

Mrs. Dhabala Damayanti has been engaged in the fish business at her own home in Muniguda village for ten years. Through her business, she earns a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Her opinion is that, though her business income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus and total investment in the business, she will be able to materialize her dreams.

So, to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of the loan. This resulted in taking the loan and purchasing a huge quantity of fish and related items from the nearest market after the disbursement of the loan.

She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion, save money for the construction of a house, and purchase any additional household assets.

The other eleven members of her group are also smart at their professions, such as vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store, and transport business. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish.

loans.name: Gulubarhan

texts.ru: Гулубархан, 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей, старший сын на заработках в России, средний работает, младший -студент.  Образование у Гулубархан высшее, общий трудовой стаж около 30 лет, сейчас работает главным бухгалтером в аптеке, получая ежемесячную заработную плату в размере 19,100 сом (KGS). Гулубархан нужно достроить дом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку железа, труб и установку ванных принадлежностей (унитаз, раковина, душ). Свои доходы Гулубархан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Gulubarhan is 49 years old, married and has three children. Her eldest son is a migrant worker in Russia. The middle one works, while the youngest is a student. Gulubarhan has higher education and work experience of around 30 years. She currently works as the main accountant at a pharmacy, receiving a monthly salary of around 19,100 som (KGS).

Gulubarhan needs to finish building her house. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase iron and pipes, and to install the bathroom appliances (a toilet, a sink and a shower).

loans.use: to purchase iron and pipes to finish the building of her house, as well as installing a toilet, a sink and a shower in the bathroom

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a female Ugandan aged 37 years old. She is married to Charles with whom she has four children aged between 16 and 7.

Juliet is a farmer who grows bananas and maize and also cassava in Kyarushesha, where she resides. She has applied for a loan of three million shillings (UGX 3,000,000) to buy improved maize seeds and also hire labour to clear land for planting the maize and coffee.

Her dream for the future is to acquire more land and educate all her children. However, she faces challenges of poor weather and crop diseases.

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire labour

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
