She wants to better stock the store, so she is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, detergent, soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, etc. In this way she will meet her customers’ demands, and she hopes to increase sales and earnings in order to pay off her debt with a good credit rating. 


She dreams of making her business more competitive, and having the financial resources available to give her family better food, clothing, an education, and health.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, detergent, soap, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, etc., and in this way, meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Christine is 16 years old and is the only child in the family. Her mother Julita, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her bakery business in the Philippines.

Christine is studying a Bachelor Of Science in Customs Administration and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course.

Julita is borrowing PHP 19,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Christine for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

Christine plans to to finish her studies and help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven que tiene claras sus metas, a sus veintiún años de edad, ya casi finaliza su licenciatura en ingeniería industrial. Apoyado por su padre que es abogado y su madre que tiene una pequeña empresa que distribuye camarones,  ha logrado salir adelante poniendo en práctica todos los valores que le enseñaron en casa. 
Este estudioso joven, que ya casi se ve coronado como un profesional, necesita una computadora para agilizar y mejorar sus trabajos, además precisa pagar los gastos de su monografía y gestiones del diploma. Por eso él solicita a Kiva junto a MiCrédito un financiamiento para comprar una laptop, saldar los gastos de monografía y gestión del título. En un futuro desea trabajar en una gran industria, también quiere estudiar una maestría y sobre todo retribuirles a sus padres todos los sacrificios que han hecho por él.
texts.en: Oscar is a young man with clear objectives. At his 21 years of age he is almost ready with his bachelors degree in Industrial Engineering. Supported by his father who is a lawyer and his mother who has a small company that distributes shrimps, he has been able to move ahead putting into practice all the values he learned at home. This studious young man who is almost ready with his profession, needs a computer to expedite his school work. He also needs to finish paying off his thesis and certification expenses. In the future, he wishes to work at a big company. He also wants to study a Masters degree and specially, to give back to his parents for all they have sacrificed for him.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and to finish paying off his thesis and certification expenses.

loans.name: Las Clavelinas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS CLAVELINAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en sunegocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to “The Pink Carnations” communal bank. This bank is located in the Lamay District, pertaining to Calca Province and the Department of Cusco.

Bertha, a member, is single, 43 years of age, and has two children. She works in her cattle-raising business. Bertha raises and fattens cattle, then sells them in different local fairs. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, and desires to get ahead by means of this activity. Her dream is to expand her cattle-raising business. Bertha is requesting a loan to purchase another cow. 
	
The remaining communal bank members have business selling animals, grains, or meals, and operating a grocery store.

Bertha is grateful to those who by this means form part of her dream and she promises to comply with her schedule of payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Luz has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh, born in 1982, is a Thai ethnic woman; she joined the program of the organization in January 2001. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in the Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover her family’s living expenses and pay for her children’s education fee. 

She has saved a little amount of money, but it is not enough to buy materials for repairing the toilet. So, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials to repair the toilet.

She really hopes the loan amount will help her family have a cleaner toilet.  She will work hard to find an extra job to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the toilet

loans.name: Karen Johanna

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Karen  es una joven muy responsable, Karen esta casada y tiene una hija de 2 años, el esposo de Karen se dedica a trabajar de albañil, Karen se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, y también trabaja a medio tiempo  en un centro de computo donde  le pagan poco y por este motivo las tardes y los fines de semana comercializan pollos para qu sus ingresos le permitan ayudar en los gastos del hogar, Karen necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar pollos y asi mejorar su negocio,  sus ingresos. Karen  aspira seguir adelante y trabajar duro para el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en: At 22 years of age, Karen is a very responsible young woman. Karen is married and has a 2 year old daughter. Karen's husband works as a mason. Karen works raising and selling small animals, and she also works part time at a computer center where they do not pay her much. For this reason, in the afternoons and on weekends she sells chickens so that her income can help with household expenses. Karen needs the loan to buy chickens and improve her business, her income. Karen wants to move ahead and work hard for the well being of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Judid Carolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia Judid Carolina se dedica administrar una carpintería, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia  elabora diferentes tipos de trabajo como camas, roperos entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Lima” from the Asociación Arariwa. Judid Carolina works managing a carpentry shop. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream. Through this means she promises to make her payments. She makes different types of furniture such as beds, wardrobes, among others, and this is how she supports her family. The member is requesting a loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with 13 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 54 years old and has six children who are still in school.

Erlinda has a buy and sell of coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing net, wood, etc for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net, wood, etc for her business

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Amparo requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Amparo has been in this business for two years now.

Amparo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie is 53 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Tessie has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and seasonings for her business.

Ma. Tessie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belen tiene 47 años de edad y habita al Sur-Oriente de la ciudad con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12, 21 y 22 años. Desde hace 25 años adquirió su experiencia como comerciante, por iniciativa de su suegra  quien la enseñó y Belén vió esta alternativa como una oportunidad de beneficiar el desarrollo de su hogar. Su clientela hoy la conforman mujeres, hombres, entre familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, a quienes les vende a crédito durante todos los dias, en los que extiende su horario laboral sin límites para satisfacer plenamente a su clientela y sostenerse en el mercado muy competitiva.  Su meta es lograr la ampliación de su capital de trabajo, aunque su mayor desafió es la ausencia de ingresos estables para lograrlo. Como alternativa para mejorar esta situación Belen está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamientoq ue ahce ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, medianate el cual comprará vestuario Productos para el hogar y de belleza femenina. Con esta inversión aumentará su capital de trabajo, impulsará sus ventas y obtendrá muchas mas ganancias que las usuales, haciendo de su crediiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Belen is 47 years old and lives in the South-West of the city with her family which is made up of her partner and her 3 children aged 12, 21 and 22 years old. For 25 years she has acquired experience as a businessperson, with the encouragement of her mother-in-law who taught her. So Belén saw this alternative as an opportunity to benefit her household's development.

Today her clients are both women and men, family, friends and neighbors from the area. She sells on credit every day without a fixed timetable so as to fully satisfy her clients and remain competitive in the market. Her goal is to increase her working capital, although her main challenge is the lack of steady income to achieve this. As a way to improve this situation Belen is applying for a loan from Kiva, her first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy wardrobe products for the home and woman's beauty products. With this investment she will increase her working capital, boosting her sales and making much higher profits than usual, making this a successful loan.

loans.use: to buy wardrobe products for the home and woman's beauty products.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonia is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Antonia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Antonia has been in this business for 10 years. Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 52 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Concepcion has been raising livestock for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosemarie has a buy-and-sell mats business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of native mats to resell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of native mats to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
Erika, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta básica, tiene dos años de contar con su negocio, lo aprendió cuando apoyaba a su familia a desarrollarlo, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, Erika vive con su hija de 4 años  de edad y su compañero de vida, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
Invertirá en detergentes, jabón, bebidas, aceite, huevos, arroz, azúcar, sal, galletas, entre otros productos básicos para fortalecer su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, espera que aumenten sus ventas y ganancias, para así cancelar el crédito con buena calificación financiera.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para comprar su casa propia y darle a su hija un futuro lleno de oportunidades para estudiar en la universidad y que se convierta en una profesional.
texts.en:
Erika is the proprietress of a store in which she offers her customers basic food basket products.  She has had her business, which she learned when she helped her family to develop it, for two years, and she waits on her customers from six in the morning until seven at night.  

Erika lives with her four-year-old daughter and her life companion.  She does not have any outside financial help. 
 
She will invest in detergent, soap, beverages, oil, eggs, rice, sugar, salt, and cookies, among other basic products, in order to strengthen her business and give her customers better service.  She hopes to increase her sales and earnings in order to pay off the loan with a good credit rating.

Her dreams are to continue working to purchase her own house, and to give her daughter a future full of opportunities to study at the university and become a professional.

loans.use: to invest in detergent, soap, beverages, oil, eggs, rice, sugar, salt, and cookies, among other basic products, in order to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is 50 years old and married with one child.

Nemesia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, diapers, cooking oil and school supplies.

Nemesia has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nemesia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, diapers, cooking oil and school supplies.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Pinky has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Pinky has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Merlita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and a fish container for her fishing business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and a fish container for her business

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of native mats business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more native mats to sell to customers.

Nellie has been in this business for five years. Nellie earns more income from raising livestock.

Nellie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell.

loans.name: Raquel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Raquel, ha evaluado que las demandas de sus clientes son mayores por lo que es necesario reinvertir, por lo que requiere un nuevo crédito para poder comprar papel higiénico, detergentes, dulces, bebidas, productos desechables, etc., le será de utilidad para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
El crédito anterior le ha beneficiado para ofrecer nueva mercadería a sus clientes; con lo que obtuvo mejores ganancias, las cuales ha utilizado para ir cancelando las deudas y disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en: Raquel has evaluated that the demands of her clients are greater, which makes it necessary to reinvest. She wants a new loan to purchase toilet paper, detergents, candies, beverages, disposable products, etc. This will help keep her clients satisfied. The previous loan helped her offer new merchandise to her clients with which she obtained better profits that she used to pay her debts and reduce the household needs.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, detergents, candies, beverages, disposable products, etc. which will help her keep her clients satisfied.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is married and has worked as a fisherwoman for the past eight years in the Philippines. She has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for maintenance work on her fishing boat. She is working hard to provide financial security and stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for maintenance work on her fishing boat.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Julieta has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is 34 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school, Magelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, egg, milk, etc.

Magelyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Magelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Perigrina

texts.en:
Christian is 17 years old and is the second of the four children in the family. His mother, Perigrina, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

Christian is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Perigrina is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Christian for the second semester of school year 2014-2015.

Christian plans to finish his studies and to help his parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 25 years old, and she has one child.

Monaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as eggs, condiments, fruit, groceries, etc.

Monaliza has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for a year, though she also earns an income from selling mobile phone electronic loads.

Monaliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, condiments, fruit, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and has three children who are in school. For the past seven years she has worked diligently running a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Lorna has applied for an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Her goal is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase the necessary construction materials to complete  the house.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Sambour district of Kratie province, Inn is 45 years old and married. She has one child still dependent on her.

Inn and her husband grow cassava and work for others to make a living. They earn about 60,000 KHR a day to meet the family’s needs.

Inn is applying for a 4,000,000 KHR loan through VisionFund Cambodia. She is going to use the entire loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for farm laborers. She hopes to see her profits rise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Endang. Endang lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about two hour's drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. Endang joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the third time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions on weekends, and he thanks all of the lenders because of it.  
  
With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Endang sees improvements in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and active mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Endang improve his business, and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Endang is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen works hard to support her family. Glen is married and has a pharmacy business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional medicine to sell.

Glen has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Glen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine to sell

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, vive en compañía de su esposo de 51 años de edad y tres hijos, toda la familia trabaja en la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina india y pisques, trabajan todos los días, salen a vender a los pueblos vecinos, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su actividad.
Comprará gallinas indias, verduras, aceite, maíz, leña y otros materiales, surtirá el inventario y así mantendrá la continuidad de la venta de tamales, espera atraer nuevos clientes y recuperar la inversión con un buen margen de ganancias.
Sus sueños son remodelar su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is married; she lives with her 51 year old husband and three children. The entire family works in the production and sales of tamales from free range chickens and tamales pisques (tamales stuffed with mashed red beans). They work every day and go out the neighboring towns to sell them. Up to now they haven’t had any difficulties with their work.

She will buy free range chickens, vegetables, oil, corn, firewood and other materials as well as stock her inventory so that she can maintain continuity in her sales of tamales. She hopes to attract new customers and to recover the investment with a good profit margin.

Her dream is to remodel her home and for her children to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy free range chickens, vegetables, oil, corn, firewood and other materials as well as stock her inventory so that she can maintain continuity in her sales of tamales.

loans.name: Mouch's Group

texts.en:
Mouch is originally from a rural village in the Banteay Srey district of Siem Reap province. She is a 31-year-old married mother of one child who is yet too young for school.

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for thirteen years. Her husband also works to help to earn more income. Together they can earn about 29,000 KHR a day to meet their family’s needs.

Mouch has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Now she and her group partner are applying for a 2,200,000 KHR loan to be split between them. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

With this loan Mouch hopes to grow high-quality rice from which she will make a good profit. She hopes this will improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Banteay Srey Distrcit

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a 43-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. 

Fawzi works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a very low income. Fawzi's home has been destroyed in the last violence on Gaza. He moved with his family to live in another rental apartment now.

Fawzi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it. 

Fawzi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fruit to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is a 33-year old woman from Calamba-Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a retailing business with only PHP 3,000 initial capital taken from Paglaum, but she is coping well with the challenges of her business.  Her husband, a farmer, is also very supportive with their business. The business is doing so well that she has decided to expand. 

Richie is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,500 to capitalize for sari-sari business selling basic commodities for additional income. She wants to restock canned goods, oil, noodles and sugar for retail. She is determined to maintain good credit standing so she can use the cooperative again in the future. She dreams also of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of her only child.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for  sari-sari store

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 32 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their school age.

Margie earns a living from beef and meat vending and an eatery business. She’s been engaged in this business for 10 years already. Margie earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional pigs and cows for her beef and meat vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Margie hopes to expand her beef and meat vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and cows for her beef and meat vending business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is from Ozamiz, Philippines. She is married and has five adult-age children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Primitiva is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to start gardening activities for added income. She wants to plant variety of root crops in her backyard. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and build good business relationships with her loyal customers.  

With her extra income, she wishes to save more money to arrange a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 48 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Rosela is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. Rosela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy a cow to raise and sell.

Rosela has been raising cows for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rosela would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and sell.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Neng.  Neng lives in East Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hour's drive from Jakarta. Neng is happily married. Together with her husband, they have two beautiful daughters. Neng owns a stall that provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall. As a woman, she decided to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband to increase their income so they can save more money for their daughters’ education later. Neng is a friendly and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Neng is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Neng improve her business and accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services.  Neng’s goal regarding Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma's latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Neng is the one who is standing and smiling. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Edinson de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de viveres al detalle en una tienda de su propiedad, donde tiene como a sus principales clientes a mujeres y en general vecinos de sector, que diariamente compran ranchos, víveres y articulos de la canasta familiar para responder a su dia a dia alimentario. Hace 20 años inició esta experincia cuando en el año 1995 despues de abandonar su pueblo natal, y sintiendo la necesidad de genera ingresos para sostener a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 20 años, decidió con lo poco que habia ahorrado con su esposa emprender su pequeño ventorrillo, que poco apoco se convirtió en tienda de mayor tamaño. Arroz, carne, verduras, tuberculos, cereales, lacteos, bebidas, etc, son los articuos que vende Edinson en su tienda, en cantidades pequeñas requerídas por las posibildiades de compra de su mercado de clientes, y son productos que tienen una rotación importante y que debe comprar con mucha frecuencia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Msario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos y bebidas,  que le servirán para disminuír la frecuencia de sus compras y obtener descuentos por comprar en mayor volumenen. Con esta inversión aumentará la rentabilidad y poco a poco cumplirá su sueño de independizar la vivienda de su estación de trabajo y continuar apoyando la educación de calidad de sus hijos, lo cual hace de un credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Edinson, age 53, sells retail groceries in his own store. His principal customers are women, and in general, people from the neighborhood that purchase packaged meals, groceries, and basic family food basket items for their everyday meals.

He started this business 20 years ago, in 1995, after leaving his hometown.  Feeling the need to generate income to support his family—composed of his wife and his two children, ages 15 and 20—he decided that with what little he and his wife had saved, to open his own little shop, which gradually became a larger store. 

Edinson sells meat, vegetables, tubers, cereals, dairy products, and beverages in his store, in quantities that are small enough for his customers to purchase. They are products with a high turnover rate that he must purchase frequently.

Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to purchase groceries, packaged meals, and beverages; and this will allow him to reduce the frequency of his purchases and obtain discounts for bulk purchasing. 

With this investment, he will increase his profits, and gradually achieve his dreams of separating his home from his workplace, and continuing to provide a good education for his children.  That will make the Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, packaged meals, and beverages.

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en:
Rossel is 38 years old, married and has two children. 

Rossel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rossel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rossel has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rossel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Solisa

texts.en:
Solisa is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Solisa sells vegetables in the Philippines. Solisa requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy assorted vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Solisa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Solisa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан, 64 года, вдова, 2 детей. У Райкан среднее образование, она ответственная и порядочная. По хозяйству помогает брат. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве Райкан есть 5 коров, она решила развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Raikan is 64 and a widow with two children. She has a high school education and is responsible and honest. Her brother helps her with her farm, which includes five cows. She has a monthly income of up to 25,000 KGS. 

Raikan has decided to develop her business and therefore has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 140,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Adalat

texts.ru: Адалат, 60 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей (2 сына и 3 дочери). Адалат в поисках доходов для своей семьи в 1984 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря непосильному труду и терпеливому характеру Адалат на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство - 4 коровы и 3 овцы. На 1,62 Га земли, она выращивает рис и клевер. Адалат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Сегодня ее деятельность приносит прибыль в размере до 25,000 сом (KGS). Прибыль от бизнеса в будущем позволит Адалат  развить ее деятельность и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Adalat is 60 and married with five children, two sons and three daughters. In a search for a source of income for her family, she started a business in agriculture and animal husbandry in 1984. Thanks to her hard work and patient character she now has a good farm, with four cows and three sheep as well as 1.62 hectares of land where she grows rice and clover. Her business currently brings in up to 25,000 KGS.

Adalat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase livestock. Future profit from her business will allow her to develop it further and to do home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district, Nary, is 29 years old and married with one child. To make a living and support her family, Nary and her husband have been growing cassava as their primary business for eight years and she supplements the income by working for others for a fee.  

This is the third micro loan for Nary with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. Nary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava plants. With this loan she hopes to cultivate her cassava to earn a better income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava field

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 49-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a government servant. Her husband is the guardian of family and manages the entire household. One of her sons has been running his own business as a rice wholesaler for the past 12 years.

Noreen's son needs to buy rice bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints her son is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Noreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son to buy these commodities for reselling purposes to earn maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of his family and business.

Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son increase his wholesale rice business.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 51 years old and has four children. Verginia is married and has two children who are in school.

Verginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Verginia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Verginia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Verginia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sheila is 38 years old and has five children who are in school.

Sheila has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Sheila requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, accessories, shorts, etc. to sell.

Sheila has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sheila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, accessories, shorts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fareeda Bibi

texts.en:
Fareeda Bibi is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working at a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Fareeda Bibi is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc. for business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Fareeda Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is 41 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Rizalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rizalie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Rizalie has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Rizalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sheryl works hard to support her family.  She operates a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service.  

Sheryl is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear items to sell to her customers.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is the responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation facilities by driving a taxi for seven years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Hameeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Hameeda's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Hameeda  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Hameeda is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Raquelina

texts.en:
Raquelina is 49 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, personal care products, bread, and soft drinks.

Raquelina has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Raquelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, personal care products, bread, and soft drinks

loans.name: Mirzobadal

texts.en: Mirzobadal is an active man. He was born into a family of workers in 1993. He is a student and studies at the university. He is single and lives with family. He likes to study economics. He wants to have a profession in economics and have a good place of work. His parents are working in a sanatorium. The salary that they earn is not enough to cover the tuition fee for Mizobadal’s education. The University is asking him to make a payment. He needs to pay the tuition fee to the university. Mirzobadal is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay the tuition fee for his education.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, noodles, etc

loans.name: Akhtari

texts.en:
Akhtari is a 52-year-old woman and the mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. He sells different types of eatable items, e.g samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc. Her husband alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Akhtari's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for business purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore Akhtari has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.

loans.use: assist her husband to  increase his food stall business

loans.name: Swanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Swanto. Swanto lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He and his wife have three children (two daughters and one son). 

Swanto owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. He already joined Ruma for a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity. Swanto has a really high spirit to improve his life and that’s what make his business  better each day.

As the business grows, Swanto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Swanto improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  

Swanto’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a latest Ruma’s product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Swanto is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 45 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Carolina has been raising chickens for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Bawi Lestari 2 group succeded in paying all of their loan to MUK on time. The settlement wasn’t attended by all members, but representated by the head, Ni Nyoman. During the loan period, the group succeded in breeding their pigs and sold them at a satisfactory price.

Ni Nyoman maintained five pigs and they grew healthy and became fat. She also had a sow. She sold them for 4,300,000 IDR and earned a net profit of 1,900,000 IDR. Ni Nyoman was very happy for that and she used the profit for daily life and savings. One member resigned because she had enough savings to continue her effort with her own money.

Ni Nyoman and all members of Bawi Lestari 2 group decided to continue to borrow a loan from MUK. Because they need to increase the population of  pigs, they need a new loan. They will still need a loan until they can support their businesses by themselves.

Ni Nyoman gets full support from her husband. He helps Ni Nyoman to maintain the pigs. This loan is being used to purchase superior feed. Ni Nyoman has just nine newborne piglets. Ni Nyoman needs a Veterinarian who always be ready when needed. The profit will be saved as capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a hardworking woman. She was born in a family of workers in 1984. 

She has six years practice in doing business. She was started her business with keeping a milch cow and sold dairy products. Mavjuda has experience in trading livestock in the animal market. She lives in a village, and doing business in agriculture is the most beneficial way for her to keep a family. 

In order to save money, she uses leftover food to feed livestock as forage. Mavjuda is a responsible, honest, and confident person. She is planning to buy livestock for her business. She is asking for financial support to buy livestock. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling dried fish  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for her business.

Thelma has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending and fishing.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Soknang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in one of the rural districts of Kampong Cham province, Soknang, aged 32, is single and supports herself by farming rice. Moreover, she also grows cassava to make additional income. 

Soknang is new to VisionFund and she is now leading a group of three female members to apply for loans. Soknang will spend her loan portion on cassava seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She also reserves some money to pay the labor fee for land plowing. 

Soknang hopes to the crops will produce a higher yield so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the labor fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband has been running his own business as a sweets wholesaler for the past four years.  He is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. 

Yasmeeen's husband needs to buy sweets and toffee in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purposes to earn the maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of family and business.  Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband to increase his wholesale sweets business

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Sreyneang is a 29-year-old married teacher with a child who lives in Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been teaching since 2010. Her husband is also a 29-year-old teacher in the city. Together, they can earn approximately $12 per day. Now, Sreyneang would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This loan will provide her and her family with a motorcycle for commuting to work. In the future, she wants to prepare the yard around her house and support her child to obtain a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
The Bawi Lestari 1 group repay their loans at MUK after they sell their pigs. During the maintenance period of pigs, they did not encounter any problems. The pigs grew healthy and avoided attack by disease. That's because all the members are very attentive in caring for pigs. Cages are cleaned every morning and pigs are given nutritious food.

Ni Nengah had two pigs and she sold all of them to repay the loan. She got enough profit to save and provide for her family. Ni Nengah has suggestions for group loans (the loan amount could be increased and the interest derived), but she remains grateful for what she gets. The Pigs Program has been shown to support family income. 

The Bawi Lestari 1 received their new loan of 24,500,000 IDR. Each member received 3,500,000 IDR. This loans is focused on purchasing superior piglets and feed.

With her loan, Ni Nengah purchased four superior piglets and feed. To reduce the cost, Ni Nengah combines a mixture of feed. Her husband helps her business by finding traditional feed, such as banana leaf, every day in his garden.

She hopes that in the next five months, the pigs will progress and grow fast so that she can sell them at a high price.  With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: purchase four superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida is an agrarian woman. She was born into a family of agrarians in 1979. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. 

She has a business keeping, feeding, and selling cattle. Recently, she has been feeding seven cattle and decided to buy one more. She has practice from childhood in how to keep animals. After about five years, she gains profit from her business. She likes to do business in agriculture. Shohida requested financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Savith's Group

texts.en: Residing in a very rural area of Mondulkiri province, Savith is married and has five children, all of whom are under her care. Growing cassava is the family's main source of income. Savith also works for labor fees during her spare time. This is her second loan with VisionFund. As a leader of a three-member group, Savith used her loan portion on fertilizers and land plowing. She hopes to make more income to better support her family.

loans.use: To spend on farmland plowing and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like candies, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, bread, etc., to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, bread, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like candies, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, bread, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ellenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elenita is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc., for her business.

Elenita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc., for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 34 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Elsa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, cereals, canned goods, noodles, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny works hard to support her family. Leny is married and has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines.

Leny requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for five years now.

Leny would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 43 years old and the mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables, e.g. potatoes, onions, cabbage, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.
Shakeela's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to the unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose. Therefore, Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of two, Neang is married and lives in a rural area of Mondulkiri province. The family support their living by growing cassava. 

Neang and her husband also work for labor fee. This is her first loan with VisionFund. As a leader of the group, Neang spent her loan portion on land plowing as well as fertilizers. She hopes this loan will enable her to generate more income to improve her family's lifestyles.

loans.use: To pay for farmland plowing and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru: Гульнору 53 года. Гульноре с мужем, детьми и невестками проживает на районе Кубадиён. Она замужем. Гульнар занимается растениеводством, как и все члены ее семьи. Она работает в этой сфере деятельности уже третий год. Гульнар обратилась за кредитом, потому что в этом году ее семьи не хватило средств для покупки минеральных удобрений. Они уже посеяли урожай картофеля и пшеницы, чтобы получить богатый сбор урожая им необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Гульнар сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" имеет более выгодные условия для женщин клиентов и создает кредитные продукты специальные предназначенные для них. Гульнар верит и надеется, что с помощью заемных средств, она быстро приобретет удобрения и завершить посев.
texts.en: Gulnor is 53 years old. Gulnor, her husband, children and daughters-in-law live in the Qubadiyon district. She is married. Gulnor is involved in agriculture, just like all of her family members. She has been working in this area for three years. Gulnor requested this loan because this year her family is short of money to buy mineral fertilizers. They already planted potato and wheat crops, but still need to treat the soil with mineral fertilizers  in order to gather an abundant harvest. Gulnor requested a loan herself because MDO Humo has more favorable terms for women clients and create loan products specifically designed for them. Gulnor believes and hopes that, with the help of the loan, she will quickly buy the fertilizers and finish her crop sowing.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to finish planting her crops

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором 38 летняя жительница не большого района под названием Кубадиён. Она носит статус жены и мамы. Дилором с мужем работают в колхозе. Каждый год Дилором с мужем сажали урожай картофеля и пшеница, этот год не стал исключением. Но она на часть участка решили посадить хлопок и ей необходимы средства, чтобы приобрести семена хлопка и минеральные удобрения. На следующий год, они планируют посадить овощи, и постепенно увеличитт урожай овощей.
texts.en: Dilorom is a 38-year-old resident from a small town called Qubadiyon. She is a wife and a mother. Dilorom and her husband work at a collective farm. She and her husband plant a potato and wheat crop every year, and this year is no exception, but they decided to plant cotton on some of the land and need money to buy cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers. Next year, they plan to plant vegetables and gradually increase their vegetables harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and cotton seeds

loans.name: Galati

texts.ru: Галати 41 год. Она замужняя женщина и мать четверых детей. Она с семьей проживает на районе Восе. Старшей дочери 19 лет, она студентка. Сыну 17 лет, он вместе с дядей работает сварщиком. Младшим детям по 12 лет, они учатся в средней школе. Когда дети были маленькими, все ее внимание уходила на них и на домашние дела, но теперь, когда дети подросли, она может заниматься другими делами тоже. Вот уже течение 5 лет Галати занимается шитьем одежды на дому. Она научилась шить у своей мамы и вот теперь ее умение приносит ей доход. Галати хочет купить современную швейную машинку, чтобы быстрее выполнять заказы и улучшить качество работы. Ей не хватает всего $100, чтобы купить машинку, и она обратилась за поддержкой к Вам.
texts.en: Galati is 41 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in the Vose district. Her oldest daughter is 19 years old, and she is a student. Galati's son is 17 years old, and he works as a welder with his uncle. The youngest children are 12 years old, and they attend a secondary school. When the children were small, all of her attention was devoted to them and house work, but that her children have grown up, she can also get involved in other things. Galati has now been involved in sewing clothing at home for 5 years. She learned how to sew from her mother, and now her skills yield her an income. Galati wants to purchase a new sewing machine in order to complete her orders faster and improve her work quality. Her is short only $100 to buy the sewing machine and requested support from You.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Djigbodi

texts.fr: Djigbodi est âgée de 32 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Mariée, elle a cinq enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari dans leur épanouissement. Djigbodi vend des chaussures en se promenant dans les quartiers afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Djigbodi s’appovisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter de nouvelles chaussures pour équiper son étagère, Djigbodi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit considérable.
texts.en:
Djigbodi is 32 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She is married, has five children to support, and works with dynamism to help her husband in their development.

Djigbodi sells shoes as an itinerant vendor in neighborhoods, to achieve a good profit margin. She resupplies three times a month at the market. 

To buy new shoes for display on her shelf, Djigbodi is requesting this loan so she can meet her target and make considerable profits.

loans.use: buy seven dozen shoes

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans, Akouwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec une personne à sa charge. Dans son quartier, Akouwa vend des objets plastiques à ses clients et parcoure toutes les rues pour trouver son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Akouwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouwa demande ce crédit pour commander des objets plastiques afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
26-year-old Akouwa is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with one dependent person. In her neighborhood, Akouwa sells plastic objects to her customers and goes through the streets to generate income thanks to this business.

To effectively address customer demand, Akouwa resupplies twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan so she can order plastic objects, and achieve more income to support the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy 18 plastic objects

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. She has been in this business for 21 years. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a responsible mother of 1 child who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for two years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do all this maintenance on his taxi, and therefore Nadia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nadia's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs, and can then provide better transport facilities to earn more income. Nadia also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income, in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Nadia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in repairing his taxi

loans.name: Sadoqat

texts.en:
“Sambusa” is a very tasty, traditional, Tajik pasty. For about a year, Sadoqat has had a business baking these traditional “Sambusa” pasties. She is a Tajik woman who was born in 1980 and knows her traditions and culture well. She is a brave, responsible, hardworking and hospitable person. 

Sadoqat is divorced and has two children. She is trying to run a business to keep her family safe. She bakes the “Sambusa” with meat, pumpkin and vegetables, and then she sells them at canteens, schools, health centers and places where a lot of people gather. 

She wants to buy equipment and vegetables for baking “Sambusa”, so she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy vegetables and an oven. 

Sadoqat really hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and an oven to make 'Sambusa'

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile habite à Adidogomé et est âgée de 43 ans. Cécile est une femme veuve et vit avec trois personnes à sa charge. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Cécile vend friperies dans son quartier  afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Cécile s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Cécile demande ce prêt pour acheter des habits et des draps pour alimenter son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Cécile lives in Adidogomé and is 43 years old. She is a widow and lives with three dependents.

To better meet her daily needs, Cecile sells used clothing in her neighborhood to generate income that can cover daily expenses. Cécile resupplies once a month at the market.

Cécile is requesting the loan to buy clothes and sheets to stock her shelf, so she can earn enough to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: buy 50 sets of clothes and 29 sheets

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Zenaida has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy grains of rice and (culinary) oil

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 32-year-old woman with one child who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Irum also provides sewing services and earns some income to contribute to managing the household expenses alongside her husband.
 
Irum now needs different kinds of material for her business like needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above items, and it will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Irum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 49 years old and married with five children.

Ellen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like coffee, milk, juice, cereals, detergent soap, beers, candies, etc. 

Ellen has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like coffee, milk, juice, cereals, detergent soap, beers, candies, etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a responsible mother of five children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for seven years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It incurs maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do this taxi maintenance, and therefore Kalsoom has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Kalsoom's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs. He will then be able to provide better transport facilities and earn more profitable income. Kalsoom also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Kalsoom is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in repairing his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Carmen Nidia

texts.es: Carmen Nidia, tiene la edad  de 62 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina de coser cual tenga buenas características para realizar los trabajos que normalmente realiza, la campra de esta herramienta le facilicitará la elaboración de ropa y así poder aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de telas y otras productos, y  ambien tener un mejor acabado a las prendas fabricadas, además de aumentar la cantidad de unidades confeccionadas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más ropa y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carmen Nidia is 62 years old and single, and lives with her son, who is her main priority. 

She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine equipped with good features so she carry out her normal jobs. Buying this machine will make it easier for her to make clothes and make the most of the knowledge she has acquired in training. This will help her to make an income to keep investing in buying material and other products and also give a better finish to and improve the quantity of the clothes items she makes. 

With this purchase she hopes to make more clothes to meet her order requests at short notice. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never received a loan from a state bank but FUDECOSUR has offered her the most convenient loan with a much lower interest rate than the state banks.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Alma

texts.es: Maria, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en un sector del municipio de San Pedro Sula junto a sus hijos y una nuera. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería  de ropa como blusas, pantalones, short, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, y vestidos. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado. El prestamo que solicita es por 12,000 lempiras para comprar más productos en blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y otros para vender y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Su sueño es seguir adelante con el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 39, is a single mother of three children.  She lives in a sector of the San Pedro Sula municipality with her children and daughter-in-law.  Her business is selling clothing such as blouses, pants, shorts, men's and women's underwear and dresses.  She has a stall at the market.

The loan Maria is requesting, in the amount of 12,000 HNL, is to buy more blouses, pants, children's clothing and other items to sell and fill customer orders.  Her dream is to continue with her business since it is the only source of family income.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, logro administrar muy bien el préstamo anterior y hoy en día tiene como beneficio clientes satisfechos, una pupusería y venta de antojitos mucho más reconocida y nuevos ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos familiares.
Como una forma de seguir trabajando está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento con el que podrá comprar yuca, harina, aderezos, chicharrón, maíz, aceite, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas y antojitos.
texts.en:
Maria was able to manage her previous loan well and, as a result, now has satisfied customers and a more well-known pupusa/snack food stand with more income to cover family expenses.
